A note to the owners if you read this. Get rid of the florescent lighting and add more soft lighting. Maybe get spend a bit to warm up the atmosphere and you will have a winner restaurant! good luck.

Prices seemed mid range for Indian Cuisine. I think we had two dishes and Naan totaling about $25 before taxes. Very fair for quality food.

Probably the best indian food I had! Highly recommended.

Went there with a group of coworkers and all of us loved the food. Price is just right.

This place may have tasty Indian food but somehow I felt bloated all day after eating here. Maybe because of baking soda in the bread. I remember hostel messes in India doing that to keep people from eating too much??? I agree with some of the reviewers here that the Owner/waiter needs to have an attitude makeover. He scowls if people ask for another round of nans.Thankfully his cellphone did not go off while we were there...And rice pudding as a desert! I can't remember when a Indian resturant got away with pulling that stunt off. India has so many wonderful deserts and surely rice pudding is somewhere down at the bottom of that list....If you have to eat Indian in LV, maybe this would be my recommendation just because others are worse (Mint-ok, Origin-terrible)

This is the best indian food you will have in your life unless you actually go to India.

The lamb is tender, no matter the dish, and the spice levels are always on point. The naan is fluffy like a big cloud on the sky (chili garlic naan is DELICIOUS!!). 

The most delicious thing though is the butter chicken. Good god almighty. He recipe is nothing I have ever had before and is apparently a secret recipe.

On top of everything the staff is polite and super kind. It's the indian cheers of Las Vegas.
I went to buffet on Monday feb-16. Price of buffer is 10.99. Tandoori chicken is awesome worth each penny. Every dish have correct amount of spice. Its best indian restaurant in vegas.

Oh WOW !!! 

The buffet here is the best Indian buffet in the whole country and I am not saying this figuratively. Me and my wife have literally travelled most of the country and had Indian buffets across and take my word this place is the best.

This place has become one of our Vegas attractions, we might someday come from California just to have this buffet.

Ok let's talk about food - 

sweet rice is absolutely mind blowing, I cannot remember a place which serves this dish anywhere which has right sweetness.


Samosas are light and non oily which makes it perfect for appetizers.

Goat curry is awesome as well if you like goat though...

All other dishes are very good and fresh as it can get.

This place serves great food! We highly recommend coming here during their lunch hour for the buffet so that you can try a variety of food and save a lot of money.

What I did find rather funny and unusual was a conversation I had with the waiter.  I asked for garlic butter naan and the way he answered the question and what he said was really weird. It wasn't until after my boyfriend and I left that I laughed about it. He said they weren't making garlic naan because if they did, people would come to their restaurant and it'll be too busy. Haha isn't that what you want? Then he kept going and said "we're going to continue serving it after the holidays. And we don't have it because it takes too long to make." Hahaha I didn't understand all the excuses. So I just said "it's all right. Not a big deal." Although I was a little disappointed they didn't have the garlic butter naan because I always order it when I go to an Indian restaurant.
I will definitely be coming back. Best Indian in Vegas. The food is wonderful and the owner is really nice. Gave my sister and I free desserts.

This is my favorite Indian resto to go to. I was a little intimidated by the surrounding area but this restaurant definitely worth checking out. This is my second time here and I love the food. Chicken vindaloo and the chicken korma are very delish! My 2yr old is a picky eater and he was totally tearing up the cheese naan and chicken korma. The mango lassi is one of the creamiest drinks I ever had. The service is great and staff is very friendly. I will definitely come back for more!!

Modest atmosphere - great food.

I went with a couple of friends while in sin city.
Garlic naan - fluffy and garlicy - yum.
Samosas - solid not amazing. Mint & tamarind chutneys were really good.
Chicken tikka masala - outstanding
Chicken Kardai - really good
Lamb vindaloo- great flavor - lamb a bit tough.
Saag - great flavor.
Rice - nice.
Owner couldn't have been nicer. His son even drove us to the closest hotel to catch a cab because it would have been more than 30 minutes for one to come.
Get off the strip and get some real Indian grub here.
The lunch buffet is great.  Especially for the price. They have a very nice variety. You can see many locals come here.

Great AYCE spot! They have a variety of dishes, all of which were very tasty. My favorite was the samosa dipped in the yogurt sauce or mint chutney. Also great was the channa masala. It had a great heat and was spiced nicely. I thought the garlic naan was a bit too garlicky but that's just my palate. The waiter was not very attentive and slow to refill our drinks.

The restaurant smells fragrant and mouth-watering upon entry. The staff are friendly, efficient and attentive (they even remembered that I liked my water without ice on my refills!) We had the buffet lunch  and it was outstanding. The variety and quality of the food was first-rate. I ate a little bit of everything on the buffet and would have gone back for seconds, but saved some room for dessert. I became a completely devoted fan on the last item I had - a small dish of rice pudding that almost brought tears to my eyes as it tasted like the kind my father used to make. I will return here again and again on my own as well as with guests and friends and relatives who visit who will truly appreciate authentic Indian food.

WORST FOOD !!!Totally disappointed with the service and food quality ... If you are in town never go for this restaurant ... I don't understand why people give this restaurant 4.4 * . It's not even worth of -4.4 * .. My parents got food poisoning after having food here .. My suggestions to owner Plz Stop serving  shit to innocent customers ..

Shared the Mr. Everest sampler level 7 hot. Thoroughly enjoyed everything but mostly the LENTILS! The service was really good as well didn't have an empty glass all night. Overall a great new experience.

I went here seeing 4.5 stars at yelp . This restaurant is not even 1 star . Food is terrible & service is worst. They offer only plain naan , neither rotis nor garlic naan . Appetizers samosas pakoras were not fresh , must be previous days left overs . Do yourself a favor and go to mint for a satisfying indian buffet.
First of all, please don't go by their advertisement "vegas's biggest indian  buffet". It is not. Food was alright. Not good selection of appetizers. Place is ok.
We are all family in this restrunt  to eat indian food we like MOMO  (dumpling) very testy food was very good .costumer service nice owner is very nice people  people . We are come back again !!!

This was probably the most disappointed I've been in a long time. I don't understand why this place such a high rating. 

The place is small and the buffet selection is miniscule. The meats are dry and rubbery. The veggies are made with heavy cream. And the ones that are not are very bland. 

We came here based on yelp reviews; but, were bitterly disappointed by everything here. Stay clear of this place. You can get way better indian food in other restaurants.

My husband and I went to have some dinner and we didn't realize the time. The restaurant was actually closed and the owner Prakash welcomed us and gave us the option to order take out. We really appreciated that, and we were worried that his staff would be upset with us for ruining their closing routine! Prakash was so nice and he took our order and we even ordered extra sides after we had put the original order in, and he still accommodated us. He didn't even charge us for the extra sides. We will definitely come here again within hours when we are in town next time. The food was amazing spicy like we enjoy.

The selection of really good Indian Restaurants in Las Vegas is somewhat limited, but thank goodness for Mount Everest. From the outside it looks like a converted fast-food joint (used to be a Burger King) but inside the decor and atmosphere are what you would expect in an authentic upscale Indian Restaurant offering fine dining. To cut a long story short, I have eaten at Mount Everest on several occasions. The food is excellent as is the service, portions are generous and the prices are very reasonable. I have tried many Indian restaurants in Vegas and none of them come close to Mount Everest - highly recommended.
Excellent food and very friendly staff.  My wife and I were searching for a good Indian lunch and found it.  They had a wide variety of vegan and meat entrees.  All were amazing. We will be back

The food was delicious. We visited this restaurant first time for dinner and enjoyed the garlic naan, Paneer tikka Masala, samosa, veg biryani and mango lassi. Everything was tasty and prepared well. However, Masala chai was not prepared well and it felt like drinking plain milk. 
We visited again for lunch buffet and weren't disappointed this time as well. Options are comparatively less for vegetarians but again whatever was available was good. Naan could have been better. Would surely visit again when in Vegas. Good option for vegeterians.

We had dinner here during the Memorial Day weekend. The food was great ! We ordered butter chicken and navratan korma. Along with garlic and butter naan. 

I liked regular naan better because garlic was not as moist and soft. I am only giving 4 starts because the chicken curry had a few bones. 

Service was good and enjoyed the dinner. Will be back once in Vegas again.

The only problem I've ever had here is eating too much. The food is delicious and the service is excellent. I've had their buffet a couple times, and it never disappoints - there are the typical things that I know and love, but there are always other dishes to try that are always yummy! When we come for dinner, I usually get chicken makhani at a spicy level 10 - positively to die for!

I know there are other places in town, but if you want the best Indian food, look no further than Mt. Everest!

It is a good place for an Indian lunch buffet. I did not find it very impressive since I enjoy south Indian food more than the north Indian food. 

Varieties are not much. There are a lot of curry varieties, but only with one kind of bread. I could have given it another star had they included another rice option in the buffet spread. 

The place was very crowded, but the staff managed the crowd well.

Outstanding as per usual. It took us a while to find a great Indian restaurant in Las Vegas, but this is it. Food quality is amazing, service great and the value for money is perfect. A number of 'top' Vegas Indian restaurants are way overcharging, but not this place!
This is by far the best Indian Restaurant in Vegas. The food is authentic and the service is outstanding. I've been coming here for years and I will continue coming here till as long as I live!!

I didn't eat their food. Walked in checked their menu and their veg Thali was 20/-??? Serious!! I know it's Vegas but come on! Get real!! Things are cheap here . 
Crime!!
Lunch buffet was mediocre.  Flavors were good but meat quality was below average.  Service was average.  Nothing special here.

I feel drunk after dinner not because of drinks but with all the great spices they have on the food. 

We had Chicken Tikka Masala and Prawn Vindulo with Garlic Naan. The flavors were all great especially the Masala. I think it's the best one I've ever tasted. The portion size was also just right compared to the other Indian restaurants I've been too. 

The only downside is the service that's why I'm giving it 4 stars. The servers were very nice but they were short handed. They need more people there. 

We will be back for sure!

Updated after my second experience..the dinner was yummy despite the bad experience, hence decided to give their buffet a try. Again, a value for money, the food quality surely stands out. The manager also recognised me from the yelp review and admitted the issue was due to a rush the last evening. I appreciate when people take the pain to check the feedback and work on that, so updating my review and comments.
Good, authentic, AYCE Indian food at a great price. Satisfied our craving for Indian cuisine. The garlic naan was so good!

Visiting from NJ where there is a large Indian population, I can say this was a great find in LV.  The flavors here are not quite as bold and cater towards more of an American crowd, but everything was delicious.  We shared the mt Everest combination meal which was a great deal and had a good amount of food. Would recommend to anyone looking for their curry fix,

I can't believe it...I've been working in an office for years now, less than 5 minutes away from Mount Everest, but it might as well have been a world away.  I've only recently discovered this hidden gem!

I'm not experienced in Indian food, run-ins with curry and the occasional purchase of naan from Costco were about all I knew.  But wow...what a flavor bomb Mount Everest is!  Very unassuming restaurant on the outside..BAM!  Get your taste buds ready!

If you're very new to Indian food I urge you, start off slowly.  The multiple (and I mean multiple) spices used to make a majority of the food can be very overwhelming.  Indians are not shy with spices and they will throw everything in the book at you!  That can be a very good thing!  Wake up your senses!  Tastes from everywhere will be making your brain go BOING!  To be honest there must be a dozen or more critical spices used in Indian cooking, all present here at Mount Everest, I'll just name a few:

*Cardamom
*Clove
*Black pepper
*Cumin
*Coriander
*Nutmeg
*Mustard seed
*Fenugreek
*Turmeric
*Saffron

Are you ready?  Thought I was but I really wasn't!  For your best options, go for the daily lunch buffet.  You get to try a little bit of everything that Indian food has to offer.  There are some definite familiar dishes along with a few that are great starting points for newbie Indian foodies.

Only a beginner?  Go for the tasty Chicken Tikka Masala over a bed of their Sweet Rice.  Sweet, spicy, but not too spicy!  Also go for the Tandoori Chicken, marinated in yogurt, garlic, ginger & herbs then grilled over charcoal.  Delicious!

More experienced?  Go get it with their Chicken Curry or their Goat Curry (yep), try a Veggie Samosa or Pakora.  Don't forget the dipping sauces!  Raita, Mango Chutney, and Tamarind are ready to accompany all of your entrees!

Vegetarian?  The buffet also offers a few good options like Palak Paneer - homemade cheese cooked with fresh spinach & herbs.  Or the Aloo Kauli - potatoes & cauliflower cooked with tomatoes, peas, cilantro, roasted cumin & coriander.  

Please, please, please don't look a gift horse in the mouth - each table comes with a basket of freshly baked naan bread!  This is critical!  The curries, Hell just about everything goes excellent with the naan bread!  It's sooooo good!  Sop up all the extra goodness off your plate with a piece of naan!  If you get a chance order a basket of the garlic naan as well.  Carbs be damned!

Mount Everest is possibly the best Indian buffet around currently.  If you go for the lunch buffet be prepared to wait.  Tables are often full with regulars!  But it is totally worth it for the flavor explosion you will be receiving.  The price isn't bad either, $10.99 a person...what a deal!  Eat to your heart's content!

I've only been to Mount Everest for the lunch buffet, but I hear the dinner buffet as well as the regular menu is on fleek as well.  I will have to come back to give either of them a go.  But for right now I am happy with my lunch buffet for my Indian fix.  I will be back!

Everybody in the world....SPICE UP YOUR LIFE!!
Delicious food and friendly staff. All the things you'd ever want from a restaurant. Great for vegetarians- even vegans.
Actually a pretty good place.   Owner is always there and very nice.  Food is good and reasonably priced.  Try the pistachio ice cream.  it's sooo good.

3.5 for food and atmosphere, 4 stars for service and price/value. I will round up to 4 stars overall.

I was craving Indian food so decided to check out this place for their lunch buffet. The interior is a bit worn, but it is clean and the workers are all very friendly.

There were a decent amount of dishes in the buffet, but not all that many to be honest. All of the food was tasty, and there was a good variety. Chilli chicken made an appearance again, and I'm starting to think this Indo-Chinese dish is a Las Vegas Indian buffet staple. While chilli chicken is indeed a very popular Indo-Chinese dish, I never saw it in Indian buffets when I lived in California or in Virginia. 

The meal comes with freshly baked naan, and there is no surcharge if you want garlic naan, though it does take a little longer to prepare and you have to ask for it. Water is included and served in cute mason jars, and the servers were pretty diligent about refilling waters and clearing used plates.

Overall, at $10.99 for a lunch buffet, Mount Everest is a good value and has decent food. It is not the best Indian buffet I've ever had, and nothing particularly wowed me or stood out, but it is a solid restaurant for sure.

P.S. I find it ironic that the restaurant is called Mount Everest India's Cuisine even though Mount Everest is located in Nepal. xD
Chicken tikka masala is good.. I wasn't very much impressed with the garlic naan.. They're too thick

As I'm still venturing out with Indian food I was very pleased with lunch today. 

The naan was good. Lunch as buffet style. 
The potato cauliflower dish was delicious even though it looked awful lol.  Indian food as a whole doesn't present well on a buffet line. 

Goat and two forms of curry chicken were all tasty and just the right amount of spicy. 
The Tandoor chicken was good but I've had better. 

Service was great and food was hot and tasty.

Went to Mt Everest again last week and noticed that some items were changed, so I'm not sure if they have different items each day or not. No goat curry, bummer!!! Anyway, the food were not as good as the last time I tried it. I mean, it's not bad, it's just not as good to be rated 5 stars. Anyway, last week experience deserved only 3 star, so I kinda averaged it out to be 4 star.

Awesome Food. Starting from appetizer till dessert. Every  food item was very tasty. Staff is very quick even though too much crowd. Manager will not lie about wait time. You will start eating before your wait time reach. Enjoyed the food. Worth the money. If they don't be greedy and increase the price like others then it will go long.

Love the food here and especially being that we are very familiar with Indian food, need it to be authentic which this restaurant is. Service is awesome and staff is very welcoming. It truly is one of the better Indian restaurants in the valley and don't let the location fool you. If you come here once, you're bound to want to return!! Love love it!!

I've been coming here for a while now. Delicious food, and friendly staff. I love the fact that they do not charge you extra for the rice like all other Indian places, which actually makes this place a lot more affordable if your on a budget. 

If you have any special requests or concerns Pracash is the man to talk to.

Also be sure to check out their lunch buffet, they have a goat curry which is very tender. $10.99 (11AM-3PM)
The worst ever food I ate in us. I ordered nonveg thali after my dinner that plate can as it is served to some other customer who orders the same. Hope no one comes here after my review

My boyfriend and I tried this because of a Groupon Now offer, and we weren't disappointed.  We ordered a chicken appetizer, the paalak paneer and a lamb dish we had not heard of before, along with some garlic naan.  The order was more than we could finish, even though we enjoyed every bite! Particularly, the lamb was so tender and succulent!

The atmosphere was comfortable and the owner came to greet us.  We would definitely go back again.

The lunch buffet special is a great deal. The naan and garlic naan were so soft and tasted amazing. The food was great also. Lots of flavor and spices. Service was good; they were very polite and professional. I ate at around 12pm and was still very full at 9pm HAHA.

This place has a great variety of Indian dishes. We were here for the lunch buffet and were not disappointed. The Naan bread was a little fatty and not as crisp as I hoped it would be but all other dishes made up for it. We will be back for sure.

You can't probably find a better Indian restaurant than this in LV. Amazing service experience. Although the restaurant was full, it didn't stop the staff from providing great service. Food was excellent. Thank you guys.
Food is great and affordable.....Great spot for vegetarians...Worth visiting...!!
Great food but probably the slowest service I've had in a long time.

we went there because of the great ratings. I don't get it!  We had the buffet which was 10.50 each.  it was horrible!  every dish was like something leftover.  The curry was mush, the pandeer had one piece of tofu in the whole tray and was not very tasty, but the worse offense was the chicken tandoori which was just dry and flavorless.  we had to put the yogurt mix on most everything that was not in a sauce because it was so dry, like the samosas.  Worse Indian cuisine I've ever had, would not go back. Also it's located in a terrible part of town.  When we left we were bombarded with people begging for food and trying to sell us things in the parking lot.  Very uncomfortable.

For god's sake can we make a better Indian restaurant. When I say better not just better food but better interior and hygiene. Even if this place has 1000+ reviews it's a run down place compared to any other dining place in us . I am giving one star for such pathetic mentality. Please improve the look and feel

One of my favorite Indian places. Be sure to specify if you don't like spicy!! The regular dishes are pretty spicy (the tikka masala was great but much spicier than I expected). The mango lassi was delicious and perfect with the spicy things. If you're not into too hot, the lamb korma is amazing, especially with a little garlic naan. Service is great and the owner is always around and very friendly. If you're looking for good Indian in Vegas be sure to give this place a try!
Delicious food - and the wait staff was very courteous inspite of an almost-full restaurant.

This is a dinner review not lunch buffet. Service and atmosphere was very good. I was really hoping to give this restaurant an honest 5 rating like many others did and also why I stopped in here.. Perhaps in Las Vegas it may be considered one of the best but I've had many Indian cuisine experiences mainly in the valley of L.A. where theres many Indian places. But the food lacked somewhat here. The first thing I was surprised at was the garlic naan bread was not included for dinner, although it was good. First time I've ever seen an Indian restaurant not serve it as complementary. The chicken tandoori was a little dry and mostly smothered in bell peppers, onions, and cilantro. Cilantro??? Had I known about the cilantro I would have requested without it. No basmati rice either although it specified in the menu that it came served with rice. Tikka was exactly the same. Now that I know a couple things about this place I may try again but order carefully. I was with a party of 6 and everyone was eh so so about the food. We were all pleasantly surprised with the service.

The food and service here is amazing. There's always a 20-30 minute wait for their lunch buffet but it is so worth it. The food tastes so authentic and is just incredible. Wait staff is very friendly and helpful. I just love this place

Okay Indian at best. Used to be much better. Chicken on lunch buffet is all overcooked. Very salty. Limited selection. No refill on naan. New tablecloths draped on the floor before set up. Won't be back. Twelve dollars. Even samosas are mediocre. New chef? Very disappointed.

Excellent!  Quality, not quality. A perfect score on their latest health inspection. Impressive!  This family CARES about their business. The chicken curry ROCKS!  All the food was hot, and flavorful.  What a GREAT buffet!  Try not to fill up on their homemade bread. Delicious. Service was very good.

My boyfriend and friends and I have been coming here to eat for about a year now and every time I come I leave absolutely satisfied; whether it be lunch buffet or dinner. The food is authentic and delicious. Some times I have to come back a few times a week. Not only is the food delicious but the service is also great everyone is really friendly every time we go Prakash makes us feel right at home. I recommend this place . Go try them out!
Awesome tasty food, Server was knowledgeable about menu. Hospitality was incredible definitely worth coming here. Food quantity is more than enough for 4 people, definitely recommend it!!!

Delicious delicious delicious. Definitely found my new Indian spot in Vegas. When I moved out of California last year I was bummed to leave some of my favorite restaurants including an Indian place I loved but this takes the cake! Everything we ordered, every flavor was so good. Not to mention, the service was great and the owner was so kind to us. (Even though we came in late on a Sunday night:)) The prices are really reasonable as well. 
We ordered the vegetable samosas, garlic naan, basmati rice, tandoori chicken and chicken tikka masala. Tons of leftovers coming home with us too. Highly recommend!! I'll be back soon to try more of their menu :)

Excellent Indian food, don't be scared by the looks of the building. I run a software company with 15 employees in Bangalore and travel there a couple of times a year, so while I wouldn't call myself any kind of expert, I do know when the palak spices aren't fresh or the nan was left sitting. Neither of those things happened at Mount Everest. Definitely recommended.
Went for the lunch buffet, it was fanastic, great menu for the price.

The best indian food. I am stuffed. Wondeful fluffy naan. The vegetable korma was a little sweet and absolutely delightful. Chicken tandoori was flavorful. The goat was tasty. Palaak paneer good as always. And the Tikka masala sauce was perfect for sopping naan in. My girlfriend loves the sweet rice and everything is just wonderful. So good it hurts.

I was surprised. Driven by this place countless number of times but never ventured in seeing as it used to be a Burger King back in the day. The food was tasty. Tried them out via a Groupon Now. The cashier didn't know anything about the Groupon which was a little bit of a turn off cause I felt guilty trying to use it but they honored it anway for takeout service. Had the Chicken Briyani and the Chicken Jalfrezi. I think the Briyani could have used for chicken but it wasn't bad. The jalfrezi was not bad either.

Awesome Indian noms!!  I was in town for business and we wanted Indian.  This place was worth the cab ride off the strip.  Great flavor, and they offer spicy.  I always order spicy, but it never comes spicy, and this place nailed it!  Great service too. Would definitely return next time I am in town!

I know my Indian food. I grew up eating it and this is a pretty good place when you can't have home cooking. The staff was really friendly. I had the Biriyani, with chicken. It was so good. One of my friends, who had never had Indian food, tried the vindaloo and loved it. The location is a little sketch but a lot of Vegas can be like that lol. Prices about expected for Indian food. Also, they don't play when it comes to spicy... You've been warned! If you're craving Indian I say check it out.

I'm not an expert on Indian food , it's probably not even on my list of top 10 cuisines, Maybe every 4 or 5 years I'll have a craving for Indian food. I'm more of a Japanese or Thai  curry person. After today's meal at mt everest I will b eating more Indian curries . The lunch buffet was really good . Everything was hot and fresh,the naan bread both garlic and plain was super . Everything I ate I enjoyed  daal,tandoori chix, some spinach and cheese dish a lot of other foods don't remember the names. Service was attentive and the restaurant look alot better inside then out,I think it was a burger king in it's former life . Like I said not an expert on Indian food, but this was goooood!!

I visited this restaurant in June, and I had their lunch buffet.  The food was excellent, and their prices reasonable for good Indian Cuisine.  I would definitely go back there when I return to the Vegas area.
We went for the lunch buffet, which was absolutely amazing!  The service was great and the food was unforgettable. I highly recommend this place.  The location is easily accessible too.

3 stars is really giving the benefit of the doubt here.  I would say service was a solid 4 stars (although there was a bit of the soft upsell here on beer and extra side items like multiple orders of naan), but food was 2 stars, 2.5 stars tops.

I really like the strong and bold flavors of Indian cuisine, and also the quality of the sauces, which tend to be very smooth, with supporting notes of texture like cashew or other items to provide some 'tooth' to a dish.  I found the sauces here to be very heavy, a bit 'gloppy' and just lacking in quality - the sauces just weren't inviting to me.  Actual taste of the sauces was ok - serviceable, but nothing great.  

Also, lamb was pretty tough, and chicken had small bones (the kinds that should not be in a dish, small enough to catch in one's throat and cartiledge - just unappetizing.  Paneer dish we had was one of the better items, but sauce still had that heavy and unpleasant texture.

I have not yet found an Indian restaurant in Vegas that measures up to Origin India in its heyday.

I've been there for lunch and I've been there for dinner. This is my favorite Indian food in Las Vegas. The flavors are all there, but it's not as expensive as many other Indian restaurants in town that I find to have less appealing food.

As far as buffets go, their lunch buffet is excellent. They always have several of my favorite Indian dishes available and they keep the warm, fresh, pillowy naan bread coming. The only problem I have is that I overeat every time I come here for the lunch buffet.

Last night was my first time trying their dinner menu, and it was so delicious. We started with vegetable samosas which were cooked very well. The had a perfect crisp on the outside and beautifully seasoned potato filling inside. Then for our entrees, I ordered Lamb Vindaloo and my wife ordered Chicken Kurma, and we both ordered garic naan to go with it. (Unlike many other Indian restaurants in town, Mt. Everest doesn't charge extra for rice. I very much appreciated that.). The Lamb Vindaloo was the best I've had. So flavorful! The Kurma was very tasty, but a little too sweet for my tastes. My wife loved it though and couldn't stop raving about it the entire meal. She's already mentioned to me how much she's looking forward to eating her leftovers.

Somebody in a previous review seemed to think the fact it's in a building where a Burger King used to be, and in a predominantly Hispanic neighborhood is a bad thing. Me? I don't care where it is or what used to be there as long as delicious food and great service provided. This place has both. 

The owner even brought us out a free rice pudding for dessert for us to try. I don't think that's standard for all guests, but it was delicious. I would recommend Mt. Everest India's Cuisine to everybody.

I used to come to this building all the time...when it was a Burger King.  This was my first visit since Mt. Everest took over.  I went for the lunch buffet.  The selections were somewhat limited, but the food was pretty good.  They bring naan to the table.  Those who have eaten at other Indian buffets know that this is a nice touch, because it seems that you always have to wait and fight for the naan if it is on the buffet line.  The workers were friendly and efficient with water refills and plate removal.  Strangely though, they did not come to refill the soft drinks.  

Like I said, this used to be a Burger King.  With that being considered, the decor was nice.  The white tablecloths are a nice touch.  The parking situation can be a bit dicey as it is located in front of a busy market.

Prakash the manager was so great. I don't typically like Indian food but my family dragged me here and I reluctantly went along. I looked at the food and it seemed weird to me but I took a little bit of everything and went to my table. The thing is, turns out the food was really terrific.

Out of the 10 things I tried I think I like about 8/10 things. Plus, the naan bread was really great and doughy. I'm not from the area, but if I was I would sure go back.

Had a craving for Indian food and Mount Everest was recommended by my cab driver. Started off with a chicken tikka plate that came out looking great because it was sizzling but after a closer inspection, i noticed it was doused in red color dye and no marination or flavor. I then had some butter chicken which had too much spice and not enough flavor. I did enjoy the naan bread however which was fluffy and soft. Needless to say- i did not take the leftovers.

One of the best Indian restaurants in Las Vegas! I wrote a more detailed review more than a year back. This one is just to confirm that this place is still as good and continues to maintain its great tasting food!

4 Stars for the food, 5 stars for the service, pleasant size, and great price.

For a small buffet it had great variety, I particularly liked the goat curry and sweet rice.  What really made my visit great was the owner.  He was constantly attending to all the tables, providing refills on water and asking his guests how their meals tasted.  Attentive and kind, while providing great food, earns 5 stars in my book!

I guess I should have reviewed it the first time I went about 3 months back as that was a 5 star performance...Still was a good buffet but I left thinking...eh...4 stars. Maybe I just wasn't hungry enough today

The tandoori chicken was just a slight bit dry and we had to wait a bit for the naan to come out.

Overall a lot of Pros:

+Every dish had a unique curry flavor...wasn't the same curry taste in multiple dishes
+Food was hot and fresh...
+Food quality was good, you'd think you ordered a la carte
+Service was excellent...water was always refilled promptly
(the guy that gave one star and said they used tap water...not the case today)
+Love that paneer spinach and cheese thing
+Chili Chicken was good

We were there early enough so that when the cooks brought out the trays, they too took some plates of food from the tray into the back for themselves. For me that means no monkey business in the kitchen...you always assume there's not but I've seen too many episodes of Kitchen Nightmares.

The goat was so-so...kinda fatty and lots of bones, was hard to find a good piece in the whole tray...for $10.99 perhaps that's not enough to cover a lamb substitute and maintain profit.

I think what was missing today were my sweet monkey balls that seem to hit the desert spot and some beef korma...my favorite dish...I think they had it last time.

Despite this not being as good as I first remembered...it's still the best Indian buffet I've tried (been to about 3)

Overall a good spread and I will be back...call it 4.5 stars.

This is by far the best Indian lunch buffet I ever had in Vegas.  The service was amazing and restaurant itself it clean and quiet.  Most Indian restaurants' lunch buffet are dishes from days ago.   At Mt Everest I could really taste the flavor of different spices they use and the meat dishes were tender but not too soft.  The curry dishes were just perfect, enough sweetness but also taste the kick of other spices they use.  
I truly believe this place roast their own spices and grind it up themselves also.

Mount Everest has to be one of the best Indian food places in town. 

Good was excellent - chicken vindaloo, tikka masala, garlic naan, fried rice. 

We're Indian food experts and this is our new place. 

The owner touched the table and gave us a complimentary dessert that was YUMMY. Ask for the honey balls.. :)

Can't wait to come back!

After Misti Y. suggested Mt. Everest to me. I had to stop by to try out their $9.99 lunch buffet. I had such a pleasant experience here. I dined solo and arrived around 1:00pm (buffet ends at 3pm). The food was still hot & delicious. The rice was still soft. And it wasn't too loud or too busy. The server and the manager were so incredibly polite. They periodically checked on me to make sure everything was to my liking and my water cup was always filled to the brim!

The food was awesome! A variety of lamb and chicken curry. A few vegetarian options. The samosas were on the salty side but still incredibly delicious. They had plain rice and a bright orange sweet rice which was awesome but I preferred to eat the plain rice with all the sauces and meats. The naan was fluffy and as delicious can be. ! I managed to scarf down a whole basked by myself!  Next time I'll be asking to try the garlic naan too. I saw a table next to me order it and it looked awesome!

The food speaks for itself but the service is what will keep me coming back.

Two thumbs up.

Its hard for me to rate any indian restaurant at 5 stars because no one will ever compare to some homecooked meals by my mom.  But that being said this food was rather tasty.  They used an appropriate blend of spices that weren't overpoweringly spicy!  For an indian person I don't do as well with spicy food as one might expect.  This was a great balance of flavor amidst the kick in my mouth.  (I did ask for mild)

I came here for dinner and not going to lie was a little turned off by the outside.  Very seedy looking place.  Then I stepped inside and saw that it was decorated in a comfortable manner.  Clean and efficient enough.  (at least for appearence's sake!).  They brought out some papadum and a couple sauces to go with it.
I ordered the shahi paneer which was good, (not the best I've ever had but again i'm partial to homecookin). 
One little complaint I had was that I needed to ask for water a couple times as I tend to drink a lot of it while eating.  This is usually a given at higher end places, but as there was only two people working and it was rather busy i'll give them benefit of the doubt.  Also when I asked the waiter if I should try the shahi paneer or the paneer tikka masala he said he didn't know because he didn't eat vegetarian food.  (in a slightly rude manner)

Overall worth the trip and they provide a solid indian food experience.

I have been to tens of places which claim that they serve Indian food, across the United States. Most of them have been utter disappointments. This place is not. Everything is good in terms of taste, look hygenic and also, people look decent. Try the buffet and the saag paneer in it with the naan bread. Goat curry has properly cooked goat pieces. The dessert is decent as well. 


if(lasvegas && indian_food):
    X = foodplace("mount_everest")
    print X

Food was absolutely delicious. Herbs and flavors really came through; fresh, not salty. Naan was perfect - light and fluffy and crispy. Complementary papadam before the meal. 
Daal soup was spicy and satisfying. We ordered two seafood and two paneer dishes; all were excellent. 

Our server was friendly, as was the owner, who came over and introduced himself and asked about our meal. Overall, a very good experience. Definitely lived up to their excellent Yelp rating!
Excellent food! Figured I would try this place out because of all the good reviews online. I got the chicken korma, regular rice, and garlic naan. Everything had excellent flavor :) highly recommend!

If you are looking for Indian food in Las Vegas, this is the place to go. The food was awesome.  We are vegetarians and there were lots of items to choose from. The service was exceptional (looking at the location and the appearance, it did not look special, but the food definitely was). There was no veg vindaloo available but the chef made it specially for us and it was superb (special thanks to them for making something so customized). Appetizers, sides, breads and rice were all excellent. The next time we are going to be in LV, this would be our to go place.

This was our first time to Mt Everest Indian Cuisine and we are SO happy we found this place on yelp. Every time we come to Vegas, we want to eat Indian food and now we have our go to place!!  The place doesn't look like much on the outside, but it is quaint and clean on the inside. When they were turning over our table, they even moved the table to clean the floor underneath!  

I ordered a glass of Merlot which they filled to the rim!!  Got my money's worth!  

For food we ordered the tandoori mixed platter ( a must!!!). We also ordered the chicken tikka masala (their signature dish) as well as the lamb vindaloo. Everything was cooked perfectly and was moist.  The garlic naan was warm and soft and delicious!  

The owner came and checked on each table a few times and was such a pleasant and friendly guy!  

We will definitely be back!!
Amazing Indian cuisine with exquisite and prompt service. I come often and am never disappointed.
Best Indian food I have ever had. Los Angeles, San Diego, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Nashville, Memphis, D.C... This place is truly legit. Chicken tikka masala, vegetable korma, garlic naan. Amazing.

If your in Vegas and your at all a fan of Indian food, stop here!

The neighborhood is a little sketchy and the place is an old fast food joint, but be brave. Inside it's comfortable and clean, and on the hot day that we visited it was cool. 

We had the sample plate that had a smattering of various Indian dishes, and all were very good. 

The owner and waiter were very nice and answered all questions we had about the food. 

We will go again next time we are in town.
Excellent, friendly service and delicious food. All the dishes were excellent. Favorite was the chicken curry and garlic naan. We will definitely be back and would recommend it to others.

The staff behaved very bad...if you ask them for "liquor menu" their reply is an arrogant "No" because you asked for a wrong menu...it's called the "Beer Menu" (not liquor...lol)

Food is average, not something exciting. All my rating is for the samosa and the Indian bread, which was always served hot! Very good service, even when it was crowded.

Overall a decent 2 star

The owner dusted the table with us sitting next to us. All dust particles came and fell on our table. Unclean.

Somosa was okay. Everything else was ordinary. Not too bad. But very ordinary.

One star especially for the service, cleanliness. Would not recommend.

We first went there for lunch.  It was okay.  Not really impressed with their buffet.  

A year later, our friends invite us for dinner there and what a difference!!  Dinner was delicious.  We had the chicken tikka masala, chicken tikka, tandoori chicken, butter chicken, samosas, sweet naan, regular naan, mango lassi, kingfisher...  

Ah so delicious!!  So far the best Indian that we've had in Vegas and very reasonably priced.  The restaurant is in a former Burger King in a mainly Hispanic part of town...but the food and service make up for it.

This is a gem in vegas. Food reasonably priced and tasted very good. Good selection of curries. Had good parking space. Only thing was the older meat that one felt was reheated on some dishes. Otherwise everything was good.

This place has the best Indian food in town! I've lived in Las Vegas 18 years and I have tried many restaurants...and I keep coming back to this one and have never been disappointed. This one should go right up in the "Best of Las Vegas" along with Pin Kaow on Rainbow (for best Thai food). 

Their lunch buffet is reasonably priced and you get a lot of choices. Their butter chicken is the BEST! And their chicken curry is awesome also.  And they serve you fresh naan with the buffet.  

If you go for dinner, its a lot more expensive, but you of course can order anything on the menu that way.

The owner is always there at lunchtime and knows us too well because we are always there!  

I highly recommend it. -SG

Amazing food and great staff. We had samosas, chicken tikka masala, alooh gobi and naan, it was all delicious. The portions of the two entrees were great for sharing and the prices were agreeable too. We will definitely be returning soon 
Very happy customers,
Natasha & Bret

So sad this is 5 hours away from us, but our new favorite Nepalese/Indian spot.  We had delicious vegetarian momos with a fragrant sauce, chicken kadai (which was a first for us) and delicious, plus a unique variation of malai kofta with a rich and creamy sauce that begs for your naan bread.

Prakash took great care of us along with his staff and even brought us complimentary dessert.  I highly recommend this place and don't show too much bravado on spice, a "7" was the perfect heat for us and we usually go "8" or "9" at most places.  Enjoy!

Delectable,  reasonable, very good service. 
Extensive menu is kindly explained for a westerner.

After a very long night Saturday night, my fella and I woke up around 11:30 absolutely STARVING.  
We got up, got ready, and ventured out, neither of us really knowing what we wanted to eat.
Our first choice was closed on Sundays (boo), so as we were driving back towards the house, I pulled up my trusty Yelp app, and did a search for nearby restaurants. 

Mount Everest was the first one that popped up, and with such a high rating, we decided that since we hadn't had Indian food in a long time, we would give it a go!

We walked in, and were smacked in the face with the most delicious aroma!  It smelled like all the beautiful spices I miss from my Indian friends cooking for me back home in Chicago. 

We were greeted and shown to a table, and told that we could go ahead and start on the buffet whenever we were ready.

For $10.99 per person, I thought that the buffet was nice.  

Lots of choices!  
First round, I tried almost everything...I was a little stand-offish about the goat curry.  I've never had goat before and was nervous, but I did try it second round.  
My favorites: 
Daal (lentil soup):  really spicy and full of flavor.  Its good on its own or over the basmati rice. 
Chicken Tikka Masala.  Uh.  YUM.  Tender chicken in a rich and creamy sauce...mmm.
Vegetable Samosas:  Delightful.  Lightly spiced, and delicious.  I went back for thirds of these, and they are really nice with the mint chutney.
Naan:  I had hoped for the garlic Naan, but alas, we only got the regular.  That's ok.  It was AMAZING.  My fella's favorite of the day was the naan dipped in the tikka masala sauce.  SO delightful!

I liked the Aloo Baingan (eggplant and potato), but it was just a tiny bit too spicy for me.
I found the goat curry very thin/greasy looking in the sauce, and it was honestly hard to get a couple pieces of meat, as there were so many bones.  It was a little fatty for me, but the flavor and cook was good.  I would be willing to try it again.  

The tandoori chicken was just kind of "meh" for me.  My fella loved it.  I'm not usually a big fan of chicken on the bone though, so I know that had something to do with it.

Service was polite and quick.  Our water glasses were never empty, and we received our naan in a timely manner.  I loved the Bollywood music and videos playing too.  

All in all, this was a good experience for me.  It wasn't mind blowing, but I found the food very tasty.  I would definitely return, and recommend it to anyone looking for good Indian Food.

I've been looking in LV for great Indian food and finally found it.  We had a group of 16, the staff was very attentive, they didn't rush us or make us feel unwelcomed for staying so long. 

The food was simply delicious.  I got the butter chicken-medium spice level which I should have kicked it up a notch but it was still so flavorful.  I started with the vegetable somosa which were perfect!  Get the garlic naan :-) 

PS - my friend got his food at a level 10, and it was just as you can imagine.
Astonishingly good chicken saag, and their onion kulcha and mint chutney is beyond reproach!

Really incredible food, great service and unbeatable prices. This is our favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas!

Every time we come in, the service is quick and friendly. The quality of the food is consistently excellent. I dream of their garlic naan :)

The portions are generous and splittable if you aren't too hungry (or want to fill up on garlic naan) and the restaurant is beautifully appointed.

Some of the best Indian food in the area! To be honest, it's not in the nicest neighborhood. But if it's mighty tasty food you crave, at a very reasonable price, take the 5-minute drive off the strip to enjoy delicious grub. Don't be scared by the exterior, which rather needs some TLC, because the interior is actually quite nice and cozy, and well-maintained.

Try the vindaloo, it's some of the best I've ever had anywhere. I wouldn't recommend the salad, it's not exactly as pictured. The naan, however, is fragrant and fluffy! 

The owner actually still recognizes us from when we visited one year ago... either we're funny-looking, or he's got a good memory. :)

Best Indian in Vegas! My husband is an Indian food connoisseur so we searched all over. The food is super fresh and tastey and the service is perfect they can make everything to your liking  such as making the Naan extra crunchy if that is what you like. Go for a lunch buffet to try their specialties. Very economical but most importantly super yummy!

This is typical family run Indian place ..just off the strip ..very enthusiastic guys and service is great .
Food is also nice . Decor could have been better but the guys friendly disposition makes for it ..the food is fresh and portion size is great .

Let me start by saying that the food is delicious (on most days). My review will be covering my lunch buffet experience only, so please keep that in mind when reading.

Pros:
Plenty of variety - Chicken tikka, tandoori chicken, saag paneer and so forth. The naan is freshly made, but be sure to mention custom requests such as Garlic naan etc while you are being seated (or they assume you want it plain).

Cons
While the food quality ranges from good to excellent, the customer service is lacking, depending on the season. The owner is a really chill guy, but he seems have 1 person working ALL the tables sometimes (which gets chaotic during lunch rush, and customer service suffers).  I've noticed he's hired more staff lately, but I suspect its only seasonal. My note to him - Keep your location well-staffed :) 

I love their carrot dessert (gajar halwa), which is light years better than the sugary Gulab Jamun. They have a salad bar, which is decent.

My advice to readers - You better make sure you are leading an active lifestyle, if Indian Buffet is your goto for lunch. Although the food here is tasty delicious goodness, its not really good for your body :/ Authentic Indian food isn't this greasy or creamy, and most Indian people don't eat like this.

Because of the health implications of eating such loaded items, I tend to go there once every 2 weeks...maybe once a month.

My boyfriend and I just had the lunch buffet. The food was FANTASTIC!! It was our first time to eat here and we will for sure be back. The flavors were so good. The sweet rice is the bomb. My water never went empty. I don't think it ever got even half empty because they were all over keeping it full. We both had the buffet, we shared a large beer, and it only cost us $40.... Including tip. We will for sure be back to dine here again. Thank you My Everest for a fantastic lunch!!

I recently visited this place for lunch. They had buffet with large variety of dishes - both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. For 11 bucks, it was value for money. I tried their vegetarian dishes and loved all of them. Kadhi pakoda was delicious as well as potato zucchini. Their dal tadka was ultimate. For an Indian like me, I thought their spice level was medium, not too mild like in other restaurants. They serve Naan on the table, which was hot and soft. Dal makhani could have been better. 
The restaurant was also clean and we were served well. I would definitely go once again.

I have tried several Indian restaurants in town and Mount Everest is by far my favorite. The food is great the prices are reasonable, and the service is fast! For dinner the Chicken Tikki Masala is amazing, and if you're looking for a good fast lunch their lunch buffet can't be beat.

I love Indian food and am able to cook most Indian dishes being an Indian from Singapore. Occasionally, we will eat out and my first choice is Mount Everest India's Cuisine. Why? The service rendered by Prakash is worth mentioning and he caters to our every needs. Thank you Prakash for excellent service and delicious food. Love the tea too..

You cannot go wrong with this place. If you are visiting Vegas and wanna try some Indian food, you have to visit this restaurant. Though I must say that I was in double mind before entering the restaurant(even after reading the reviews) because of the outside ambience but glad we went through it. Their saag paneer and dal(yellow) were fantastic along with soft breads. 
Staff was friendly and fast!!
Food quality is bad but it's a cheap option. Don't expect for good customer service. Lacks basic courtesy .
My wife and I went last night . This now is, by far, our favorite Indian Joint. Amazing

LOVE it!  I have eaten here about ten times now, and it is a pretty new restaurant, so that is saying something--especially since I am a very picky eater.  At lunch you can either have the buffet or order from the menu; at dinner you order from the menu.  Many of the items on the lunch buffet vary from day to day--some days there will be chana masala, some days vegetable korma, etc.  It's always great.  I actually like ordering from the menu better, though.  The owner is a very nice guy and works hard to make sure his customers have everything they need.  I have introduced several people to this place, and they all come here regularly now.  And some of them are pretty picky people, too.

Garlic Naan was very soft and delicious with slight crunchiness. Don't order the Pista Kulfi. They taste no where nowhere near to original kulfi.
The service was good and they didn't take much time for the order to arrive.

This is the best Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas!!  It is my go to restaurant when I am craving Indian food.  The have a lunch buffet which is a great value for the large number of choices you get.  There are numerous vegetable and meat dishes.  The chicken makhani and chili chicken are my favorites.  The food is appropriately spicy and goes well with a Mango Lassi.  I have also eaten dinner here and taken dinner to go.  I enjoying having dinner here and have always enjoyed the food I have ordered.  There garlic naan is excellent and very garlicky.  Definitely try the Chicken Korma at dinner!  The owner is very friendly and always remembers me when I visit and says hello.  The service is very good as well.  You should definitely give this restaurant a try.

Best Indian food in Las Vegas. Anyone who loves and have passion for Indian food they should certainly go to this amazing restaurant.  Everybody who waited on us was very nice and friendly. Customer service was great. They were serving food with smile and happiness and that's make a big difference now a days.  The restaurant manager(Prakash) even came and ask us who is food and everything. The restaurant ambience /atmosphere was so great. Everybody was so professional. I should definitely mention that restaurant is so clean. I went with family and even kids loved their food. This is going to be our permanent Indian food stop when we come to Vegas. Prakash  and all his staff helping him and food deserves MORE THAN 5 STAR.
Mt. Everest is the highest mountain on Earth; in terms of indian restaurants in Las Vegas.... this is that one!

Had dinner here tonight and we shared the chicken korma, tikka masala, and channa masala. All were delicious....even the small plates like garlic naan and samosas. The medium is fairly spicy so it is plenty of heat for anyone. I'd recommend any of our dishes, particularly the korma. The owner, Prakash, greeted us and showed true hospitality which is rare sometimes in Vegas. We look forward to our next visit!
The best indian food in Las Vegas.  Tandoori Grill and Chicken Curry are amazing!  This restaurant is a Gem!

This place is so yummy!!! I went for the buffet which is a great price for all you can eat. The owner is really inviting and made sure we were comfortable. The Naan bread is so fluffy and good. Everything I ate was delicious. I will definitely be a returning guest and bringing more people with me!!

Busy place with many multi-generation Indian families enjoying a night out.  Not very big but we were seated within 5 minutes of getting there on a Saturday night with no reservations.  The mango and yogurt drink was refreshing.  It was reasonably priced and everything was wonderful.  The servers and I'm guessing the owner paid great attention to us and the other diners.  Will come again!

Worst Indian food ever!!!! Worst Customer service ever!!!!
VERY VERY unsanitary. One of the servers sneezed Infront of me in the lobby and did not even go to wash his hands.

Still my favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Praicash is friendly, personable, and provides a relaxed atmosphere. The staff are kind and don't seem to mind at all when we bring our rambunctious 2 year old with us. They are also reasonably priced; don't charge extra for rice or any silliness like that. 
And the Taj Mahal goes great with a spicy dish. 
Also, lots of vegetarian dishes to choose from!

A bit sketchy on the outside, and thankfully I did not judge the book by its cover.  Buffet had many good options and was a steal at only $8.  Naan was among the best I had in Vegas this trip.  The korma sauces were rich and flavorful, just as other yelpers mentioned.  I think the one I had was cheese cubes with peas, and it was quite delectable.

Love the service and food.  This place really has a family-run establishment atmosphere.

Perfect naan and paneer tiki masala.

I've been on a quest to find the best Indian cusine in las Vegas and My Everest comes 1st every time! And trust me I have tried many. Everest is nice, delicious food, friendly staff, and great food any time of day!

This was a nice little find off the strip. We came for the lunch buffet which was $10.99/person. 

BUFFET ITEMS:Vegetable korma, yellow daal, chana masala, vegetable samosa, sweet rice, basmati rice, vegetable pakora, chicken tandoori, chili chicken, chicken makhani, chicken curry, goat curry and the BEST part was that they had my favorite GULAB JAMUN!! 

The chicken curry was very flavorful, it had a great balance of creaminess and spices. It also contained big chunks of chicken which is what most people tend to skimp on (abundance of protein is always a plus in a buffet dish). I was surprised that they had goat curry (gamey stuff is not my cup of tea so this one I did not try). The gulab jamun were little balls of perfection. 

SERVICE: our server was very attentive and quick to refill our glass of water.

I subtracted a star b/c although the gulab was legit, they only had the gulab and rice pudding for dessert. There was no mango pudding or the carrot halwa the sweet carrot dessert, but I guess you can't have everything. I also wasn't a fan of their naan that they offered. A good naan has a little bit of crispiness and SOME flavor. This NAAN HAD NO FLAVOR whatsoever and was very thick and heavy. It was more of a PITA than a NAAN. 
                  
For $10.99, I would come again.

This place is so good. The food is clean. Service is great. Very reasonable price. Yes it's busy because food is great. The best Indian food I have eaten in a long time. If I go to Vegas again I will sure go here again .

A real hidden gem of Las Vegas. I've been going here for a couple of years now and have never been disappointed. It is a local favorite and do not be surprised if you see the Mayor and former Mayor there. I'm a big fan of the Chicken Tikka. When my family comes into town I love to take them here. I highly recommend.
Oh it's so good. I enjoy the chili chicken. The owner is a good man too, all good staff.

Worst service ever... No sense of serving... Ordered food just small one and it took 20 min for that.. Very slow and worst food... I would never recommend this restaurant to anybody... This is my first yelp comment... Because of these people i created account and to enlightened other that this restaurant is not worth for such a rating

Good place for Indian food, with some decent choices, although the buffet price have gone up a little with not much improvement on the choices. Service is ok, not super friendly and choice of food on the buffet, which pretty tasty is very limited. Would help to have better description of the dish selections since not everyone is a native and would want to know what we are getting. I still go there from time to time, expecting a better experience, but at least the food is good enough to have a (barely) positive experience.

Great lunch buffet at a great price. We ordered gulab jamun (which is sometimes on the lunch buffet but not the day we were there) and it was incredible. Owner was very nice, we'll definitely be back!

Great atmosphere and even better food. I am not experienced in Indian cuisine (this was my 1st experience). I had the lunch buffet so I could try a little of everything. The lamb and chicken were moist and tender, and everything was very flavorful. The lunch buffet is a steal at $9.99. I was overly impressed by everything at this restaurant.

Great Indian food, great service. This place doesn't look like much from the outside and is not fancy on the inside but this place is great! Had the chicken tikka masala garlic and cheese naan, and milk chai tea. All were extremely good but the naan is so delicious! The waiter was very patient in answering all my questions as I was a little nervous about what to try as I am new to Indian food and wasn't sure what was spicy and what wasn't. The service here is always great even when packed and I am always impressed. I highly recommend this place.

Phenomenal service, extraordinary food, and a spot in Las Vegas that no one knows about. I bring my Asian, white, and Hispanic friends here all the time. And every time, they are amazed by this culture. Any restaurant that can impress all cultures is an extremely rare thing. 

Three key elements

FOOD: 10/10 

Reason being is because the food here is diverse and encompasses all common aspects of Indian food. Unfortunately, most places offer one or two specialities, and the rest is bland. Ever dish at Mt. Everest is a speciality because I can't find any other place with better food.  NO GREASE, NO FUSS, AND LOTS OF VARIETY! FOR UNDER 12 FOR A LUNCH BUFFET. their fresh baked bread I could eat all by itself! 

SERVICE: 10/10

the owner himself, pradesh, was walking around to greet, and serve the customers. Any owner that is willing to clean and pick up dishes, is a phenominal manager in my name. And I have worked in food industry as a floor manager for 3 years. Extremely friendly, and sincere. Two things that are rare in this world! 

AUTHENTICITY: 

My best friend is very native to india and a wealthy person. He chooses this place over fine dining restaurants every time he visits me. There's nothing more to say. 

This place is the only Indian restaurant that will sincerely and fully impress you.

-Charles

Great service.  Very polite staff.   The onion bhajis were okay.   They were not what I am used to.  They were flat and Round.   The mixed veg appetizer was a bit overpriced fir what you get.   The lamb tikka kabob was not spiced very well.  It could have used a sprinkling of lemon.   The chicken tikka was pretty good.   The began bartha was very good.   The spices were just right.   The restaurant was very clean.   The staff was very personable.   I would rate the restaurant 3.5 overall.
Wonderful buffet in Vegas!!! Good vegetarian choice but not so much sweet option !! Try carrot halwa here!!! Amazing!!
Don't go by these ratings. Food is not that great. Service is okay. We didn't like anything we ordered apart from Mango lassi and chicken tandoori.
Great food and friendly service!! People were lined up at the door waiting for the doors to open for dinner! I was shocked!
Excellent various food, it's best buffet I have ever been going to. I used going there pretty much since 2010. Nice cozy and good service.

I am a regular here. Best value for an Indian lunch buffet. The Naan never disappoints, try the garlic naan Most of the food is somewhat spicy as it should be. The owner doubles as a waiter and even with 6 tables and 8 booths the service is still excellent and he also works the register.

We were here for dinner.  One of the best meals we've had in awhile.  Please note that the food for dinner is freshly prepared and has no relation to the lunch buffet.  My husband had a mixed tandoori platter, and I had a vegetarian platter.  Then we shared.  Probably enough food for four people, but it was so good that we polished most of it off.  The vegetarian platter came with an appetizer of deep-fired vegetable fritters - well seasoned and not a hint of grease.  Also a rice pudding dessert - sweet and light.  A standout was the homemade cheese in the palak paneer.  Also the naan.  The chicken tandoori was the best I've ever had.  So often it can be dry and stringy.  This was juicy, tender, and perfectly seasoned.  There were two servers, both gracious and helpful.  Although this place is close to the Strip, it was not touristy.  We'll be back.

Veggie options are very good here! I love the basmati rice. It is cooked to perfection!

I have been here many times and they have different options in veggie dishes. My last visit they had an excellent cabbage dish which was sauteed in yummy herbs and spices.

You like Indian food? 

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. WORTH EVERY PENNY! Staff is nice, portions are great, and the energy is wonderful.

The food was great with only a few disappointments.  The Goat stew the meat was a bit tough but the flavor was good, disappointing though cause goat meat is usually very tender and is hard to mess up.  The biggest fault was the chicken curry.  The chicken curry had very little flavor that stood out and considering all the other fantastic flavors of the other dishes was a bit bland. I still give them 4 stars.  Cause everything else was really really good.  The restaurant was very clean.  So now that I reviewed the food I will say that the service was just mediocre.  They don't check on their guests to see if they need anything and are usually talking among themselves in the front corner of the restaurant by their register.  I would return however to this place again.

First off I didn't expect to have the best experience but I was so wrong. We were welcomed right away and serviced water right away. The restaurant was very clean as well as the buffet. The food was kept fresh and hot. The owner was very nice and helpful with explaining the dishes.  Coming back on my next trip.
I have been here a few times and it is always great the reviews are true! Certainly the best Indian on west side and reasonable!!

Never ever go for a Thali for dinner here, I have never ate such a worst thali at this expensive price here.... Staff were good in response but the food dint deserve the dollars paid... Especially veg thali is the last option here. Comparatively veg biryani tastes better however its not superlative. Probably i made wrong turn coming here.
Absolutely delicious, every time. Favorites include the makhani chicken, vegetable korma, and lamb keema. Staff is incredibly friendly and polite. 10/10 would go again.

By far, my favorite indian restaurant in Vegas!
I originally found out about them through groupon.
I stopped by while in the area for take out.

My go-to dish is often Chicken Makhani (heat: 6-7)
but the second time I decided to opt for a dish that wasn't so heavy and the waiter recommended the Lamb Curry. 
The lamb was cooked to perfection!
Lamb that is not cooked correctly is tough and gamey!
The portions are generous and the price is more than reasonable. 

I will continue to go out of my way for Mt. Everest!

I have been craving Indian food for a while. Haven't gone to any of the well known places in town until today. We were downtown  and close to a few Indian restaurants  and decided on Mt. Everest for lunch. 

The minute I opened the door, the aroma of Indian spices welcomed me in. It brought back memories during my years in The UAE. The place looked clean, the staff were friendly, attentive and helpful....and the food was really good. They serve hot buttered naan with the meal. I requested garlic naan and they happily obliged. I excitedly went around the buffet to check what they had to offer. The first thing that caught my eye were the samosas. It was hot, freshly cooked and pretty good. More doughy than what I'm used to but still good. Then I see the chicken curry and goat curry in the very corner...boom! Be still my heart!  Those two dishes didn't disappoint at all. The goat pieces were so tender and the gravy was addictive. The chicken curry was equally good. I couldn't stop dipping my naan in the gravy. The chutneys totally complimented the curries. I also tried their chicken tikka and their chicken tikka masala. They were ok. They also had about 4 vegetarian dishes but everything pales in comparison to the curries. For dessert I tried kheer and gulab jamun. Their kheer was refreshing and not overly sweet  with a slight cardamom taste. Gulab jamun is good too but too sweet for my taste. 

The place got pretty busy around 12ish. They had a lot of South Asian clientele which is a good sign. The owner, Prakash is nice and friendly. He was constantly making sure that our needs were met. We left happy and full. 

Price for a lunch buffet : $10.99....definitely not bad! 

I wish they served biryani during lunch but no worries. This place is definitely worth trying. We will be back!

Our verdict:

Service - 5*
Food.    - 4.5*

For my sister's 18th birthday, I suggested we skip the overdone Italian option and try Indian. Everybody was down, and I got to give the teenagers a decent intro to the cuisine.

As a party of seven, we ordered so many dishes.

Vegetable and keema (lamb) samosas were a good introduction and came out piping hot. Kachumber Salad, I could eat this forever. Such simple ingredients (lettuce, cucumber, tomato, and a dressing), with a nice clean flavor.

And then the barrage of flavor with Tandoori Chicken, Chicken Tikka Masala, Chana Masala, Aloo Palak, Lamb Korma, Dal Tarka,  Chicken Biriyani, Garlic Naan.

Service was excellent and attentive. They brought our dinner to a close with a complimentary rice pudding.

I look forward to returning and trying the Thali, which is a special made up of a little bit of everything.

Felt like Indian food today, so I decided to check this place out.

Pros-buffet at a good price, flavorful food, good Indian music, nice dim lighting.  Great experience all around. 5 stars. 

Cons-none
Food & service here is amazing! Ordered 3 vegetarian dishes to share: Paneer Tikka Masala, Korma and Palak Paneer, plus garlic naan. SO GOOD and SO FULL!

If Indian Cuisine is what you are looking for then this is the best bang for the buck in Las Vegas. Take it from a native of 35 years. I've tried many places across the country and it's great to know a top tier restaurant is nestled like a hidden gem right down the street from me. You know it's good When our former and current Mayors "The Goodman's" will be your potential dining patrons. The wait staff is top notch and they always get the order right the first time. I recommend the chicken tike masala with garlic naan. You can't go wrong. Just my opinion though. Give them a try. You won't be disappointed. :)

This is an extremely good Indian restaurant. The chefs certainly know their way around a spice rack. My favorite dish so far is the vegetable korma. I'd suggest ordering a side of garlic naan with your meal, since it's hands-down the best naan in town!

I highly recommend this restaurant.
It was like my mouth went on a journey to heaven:) I've been here twice before with my best friend and every time it's been so satisfying. The lunch buffet is always worth it.

Phenomenal. The butter chicken, the garlic Naan, the chicken tikka masala, the tandoori chicken, the rice pudding, all incredible. I don't like to review until I've tried multiple dishes and I'm sure. This place has exquisite Indian food. The food is spicy where it should be, sweet where it's needed, and a great balance of flavors that aren't just overdone to compensate for poor food.

Truly authentic, from the moment you walk in, you smell the rich roasting spices, and are greeted by a warm and inviting staff.  The owner takes personal responsibility for your visit, always there to check in, refill your drink, or talk about Katmandu, Nepal, where he's from. The only Indian food in the desert I'd recommend. Period.
Not recommended for dinner. The chicken makhani was made with overcooked meat and chilli chicken was made with refried meat probably cooked few days ago, it was tough as leather.
Excellent Service, Excellent food!  I will definitely come back again!   Prakash thanks for the great atmosphere and food!
Best Indian food and Buffet in Las Vegas. A great value.

I've been here a few times during my vegas visits for the lunch buffet.  The rice, spinach, and chicken.  The chicken curry is aromatic.  The naan has a buttery taste and and the oranges are sweet and juicy.  We always make sure to include Mount Everest in our vegas stays.  Definitely check this place out.  Looks ghetto and is in a ghetto part of vegas (lots of bums hang out at the adjacent gas station) but the food is worth the short drive from the strip.

Upset our stomach!!!  Within an hour both of us running to bathroom.

The first visit the buffet was good and fresh..although a little too spicey.

We went back for dinner a few days later. The food was not fresh. It was  heavily spiced even though we asked for very little if any hot spices.
The desert was hard and couldn't be cut with fork.

There are so many reviews, so I'll keep it short. This place is awesome. For an $11 lunch, you get a buffet-style taste of authentic cuisine from India with attentive service every step of the way. A must-try for seasoned lovers of Indian cuisine and new-comers to this culinary niche alike. I'll be back!

Used a Groupon deal here. Wasn't sure it was good for the Thali, which if you go to an indian restaraunt is your best deal. You get a bit of everything.
Like previous reviewers, this place is owned by Nepalese. When you drive up it looks almost like it is dark, not open from the outside, but I think thats because of the glare stuff they have on the windows for the heat during the day time.
The service was great.
We ordered a vegetarian Thali and I ordered the Mt. Everest Thali, which came with lamb, tandoori chicken and butter chicken, along with the vegeterian options.
Normally at other indian restaurants I never get appetizers with the Thali. This came with the usual Paperdums, which had both mint chutney and tamarind chutney, which was made fresh you could tell.  In addition to that we got pakoras, fried califlower, and appetizers size chicken pieces and lamb.
Ours came with dessert. Rice pudding and Gulab Jamman. The best we have had thus far. The Gulab was nice and firm and the syrup was thick not watery like I normally have experienced. 
We also ordered chai. It came in a big 32 oz cup, like a take-way, and was made fresh because it was pipping hot. My boyfriend wanted to go back the next day just for the tea!
Highly highly recommend this, especiallyif you know your indian food, much better than Tamba on the Strip.

I'm still a bit of an Indian cuisine newbie, so bear that in mind with my review.

Figured a lunch buffet would be a good way to sample a variety of dishes. The buffet line itself wasn't very large, smaller than anticipated. The standouts for me were the samosas, chicken tikka masala, and goat curry. The goat curry was almost like a very tender beef pot roast. Unfortunately I think the tandoori chicken suffered from being on a hot buffet line because it was extremely overcooked and almost inedible, though you could taste the flavors. It was a bit of a shame.  There was also an eggplant and potatoes dish that was extremely tasty.  

Unfortunately I got full quicker than I wanted to, and one plate for me was enough. Though I wanted to go back for seconds of the tikka masala. 

Service was efficient, with several of the guys always pitching in to refill waters and take away used plates. Don't know if dinner time is different, but at lunch the employees seem to not wear any uniform and just wear casual clothing. Which there's nothing at all wrong with, but at times it was hard to tell who was an employee and who was a customer. 

Mount Everest doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside is some tasty food to be found.
Awesome food, many varieties & best price. This might not looks like a great place from outside, but I loved the food. Best part was there were 15-20 dishes in lunch buffet & all were  really good.

This restaurant is really wonderful. Went on a Friday evening, and was greeted by a friendly host right away. Appetizers and main course arrived quickly. The food was absolutely divine. The flavors were rich and full, spicy, but not too spicy. The kind of food that you want to keep eating even when you are full. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. My family will definitely be going to this restaurant again.
The best Indian food in LV.  Great food, terrific service. Well worth the drive wherever you live.  Lunch buffet terrific also. Friendly staff.

Thursday lunch, spouse and I arrived at about 12:25 and were seated quickly by a friendly male.  The booth had white linen table cloth and white cloth napkins with better than the usual flatware and water goblet.  Unfortunately, lunch is ONLY the buffet for $10.99 [it is not clear if this is ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT].  A menu is only for dinner.
The buffet had a "sneeze" shield with sticky notes with handwritten names for whatever was under the shield.  The labels were for the Indian name of the dish; not very helpful if you're not an Indian speaker.
The "wet" items were soupy and the "dry" items were dry to an extreme.  The two best items, IMHO, were the chicken curry and the white rice, while the others were forgettable.
