The condiments I normally associate with curry [like coconut, peanuts, grated onion, etc. were absent; although the chutney was present, but unremarkable as chutney].
I would hazard a guess that those giving five stars are native speakers and are familiar with the food in the buffet.  Since I'm neither, this made things awkward.

Amazing food, very welcoming staff, great service, value for money...... good food... Come Vegas!! Come Mt. Everest!! m short of words....5*.
Spcl Thanks Mr. Prakash and Praveen..
& whole staff!!
Ok Indian fare for lunch. Curries were hit or miss. Service was decent for this kind of restaurant.

This was the best Indian food I've ever tasted. My friends and I love Indian food and have tried just about every place in Vegas. Happened to stumble across it and wow! We must say we are impressed. If I could give 10 stars I would. Their tandoori chicken and Tika massala chicken was absolutely the best! Has become my favorite Indian spot in Las Vegas, and the owner is just the best and most accommodating! Has my recommendation!
Impeccable food and service at lunch and dinner. Butter chicken, saag paneer, garlic naan all on point. Wash it down with a Haywards 5000. Great place!

It is very rare that I change my first impression, but that was the case here with this one.  My first visit to Mount Everest was not a good one.  I didn't think there naan was good, didn't try the sweet rice, and the samosas were overcooked.  

Well, wow.  I have been back like, 7 times in the past month since that initial visit.  It is by far my favorite Indian lunch buffet place.  I had 3 in the running but Mt Everest is on top.  First, the price.  I believe it is 10.99... not bad.  Second, the choices.  It has the most choices I've seen!  What could make this place better?  If their labels were more specific.  I love the way some buffets put "vegetarian"; as a 75% vegetarian I like a quick reference guide to vegetarian options.  But... with my minor knowledge of Indian food I know what most of their dishes are.  If it were my first exposure to Indian food, however, I would be S.O.L!

Also another thing they could make better.  Their naan.  I don't like their naan.  I like buttery, garlicy soft guusy naan.  This is not my favorite place for naan (Saffron is).  If you like medium-textured, little buttered, barely garlic-ed naan then you would like it.  Other than that, it's so good!   Their choices are amazing.

Final thing (this is the Nutrition student in me):  They are so sanitary!  One of the only Indian buffets I've seen with in-place "sneeze guards" on their buffet.  Their buffet is actually buffet style so it has the coverings.  Furthermore, their bathroom has a sanitary spray above the handle.  How great!  So even if nasties don't wash their hands, I won't get their germs from when they open the bathroom door open.  Foodborne illness is no joke, yo.

P.S.
Try the sweet rice!  

P.S.S.
The Bollywood they play on TV is a great compliment to the atmosphere.

1st time eating Indian food. I love spicy. So we chose their 2 of their appetizers (veg. Samosas) not that great. Tastes like it was frozen and thrown to fry. The other is chicken dumpling (forgot the name) which was delicious!!!!!!! Their sauce that came with it was also amazing
Lamb curry and chicken curry as entrée  and I loved the lamb (not much a chicken with fatty person) very yummy sauce. 
Desserts. Never ever loved another dessert from diff ethnicity. Pistachio ice cream is sick! Insane taste. And rice pudding delicious. 
Wow wow wow. 
The only thing I didn't understand is why waiters don't dress the same so you know who is waiter and who isn't. 
2nd- the 2nd appetizer came out after 30 min. Maybe it's because the place was busy. 
It's my first time trying Indian food and only 2 out of 3 people knew how to explain each order

In other words the food was amazing. The desserts were even better!
Always delicious food!  Very nice service as well. I like that it's close to my home but I'd drive across the valley to eat here if I had to.

One of the best Indian buffet yet!  Excellent food selection and display ! Samosas and Chicken Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, Sweet Rice, Lentil, Chutney, Naan are 5 stars!!! And try Chai tea too!! 
For $10, this is an amazing spread! Restaurants clean, definitely made it onto my fav lunch spot list !
This is by far the best Indian Restaurant is all of Las Vegas! We come here at lest once a week. The food spectacular, service is amazing and the prices are great! Always such a great experience.
Have been here several times for the lunch buffet and it's always been great. Very friendly staff and delicious food.

Every time I have been there is great! The food is fresh, the naans are just perfect! 
If you are new in Indian cousine you should try the Thali
The tandoori chicken, yellow curry and naan is great! I'll be back!
Good stuff, will definitely meet your  need for Indian craving. ..would come back for sure!
Been coming here for a long time and food is always good. Service is also good. My personal favorites are chicken curry and palak paneer. Lunch buffet is the time to go

A little underwhelmed by the much-hyped Chicken Tikka Masala. Ordered take out, added on the garlic naan and galub jamon. Specified a spice level of 5/10 for my 'tikka and order was out in 10 minutes flat, with a large side of basmati rice.

Chicken tikka masala was a good size for the $13 price tag, which included the rice. Garlic naan was worth the upcharge: delicious, soft, and flavorful, with a garlic scent that wafted through my car as I drove home. 

My disappointment came when I finally tried my entree. For a spice level of 5, I tasted absolutely no spice. And the sauce had a sweetness to it that I am not familiar with. It wasn't necessarily bad, but the dish didn't have the kick to it I was craving. 
Chicken in dish was in large chunks, sauce was a smidge on the thin side.

Based on other reviews, I'm going to have to come back for the lunch buffet and reevaluate.

This place is amazing! $11 for a lunch buffet of all you can eat amazingness! The staff here is delightful, and very very helpful. The Bollywood videos playing while you eat are quite interesting, too. 

They have traditional Indian rice, and the (Orange) sweet rice is absolutely delicious! I particularly enjoy the black lentils and the chicken tikka masala. The naan they bring to the table is wonderful to have with your meal. The place is really small, so if you want the lunch buffet I would suggest going right at 11 am or after 1 pm, as it really fills up fast!

I give this place 4 stars!

Thoroughly enjoyed the meal and service (we arrived before the crowd and were spoiled by three charming waiters). The flavors were authentic and portions very generous. Definitely will return for the buffet.

Came for the lunch buffet. 
It was not the same food quality and taste as the normal dinners they have. The chicken and meats were really dry and the spices were way off par.I will not go again to there lunch, but for 10.99 what do you expect.
Those who have rated this establishment highly have dead palette. The ambience and service is okay. But food is greasy, tasteless, possibly unhealthy and pricey for the price.

The food here is A-MAZ-ING!!!! I have been craving good Indian food for a long time because the food where I live is horrible but this place exceeded my expectations! I had chicken tikka Marsala with garlic naan and let me tell you if I an unlimited stop I could get it all day and for every meal! I was in heaven! If you are looking for good Indian food do yourself a favor and COME HERE!

We were recommended here from the owners daughter who always does my eyebrows. I have to say,this is by far the best indian restaurant ive veen to in the valley! Wish i wouldve gone in sooner.

We were greeted by Parkass -- who by the way, was a nice gentleman eith a great personality. He made us feel welcomed and no complaints on service.
The atmosphere really makes you feel like your in india! The selection of food for the buffet were delicious and fresh. I was really impressed that they were serving chicken tikka masala--one of my favorites!! The garlic naan is a must try!!! Hands down the best garlic naan i have ever tried. The bread was baked into perfection.
The rice pudding was a delicacy! 
I recommend this place!!! I prefer to drive an additional 1 mile than india oven. (We went there yesterday and walked out immediately cause food dont look fresh) come to mt everest and experience a day of indian cuisine:)

Local celebrity Yuhi K. recommended Mt. Everest to me and oh boy was she right? Oh yes. I'm a Brit, we know , or think we know, everything about Indian food. We grow up eating the stuff, there are more Indian restaurants in England than Mickey D's. Really! Would I embellish? Maybe but I don't think so in this instance.

Anyway, Friday night and the kids ditched us. Outrageous I know, but gives Wifee and I a rare chance to eat what we want. "Yuhi K. recommends a place down on Sahara" I explain. "Who is Yuhi K.?" asks my leader. " She knows about food" I explain unconvincingly.

It is a long drive down W.Sahara from my hood and Wifee is viewing my choice with suspicion. " It will be great" I proclaim "be patient". 

Mt.Everest sits in front of a slightly rundown strip mall but parking is easy and my expedition was a success.

We were greeted promptly and offered a table or booth. Booth. The greeter/server guy seemed to be the owner. He was great. Recommended a great beer, Taj Mahal, 1.5 pints of frothy cold delight, Wifee grabbed a nice cold Chardonnay.

We started with a mixed dish of samosa, kebab, chicken tikka and some other stuff. Fantastic and more than enough to share.

Mains: I had a Mushroom lamb dish, I am asked how spicy I would like. being a big shot expert Indian food eater , I asked for 7/10. Too hot! I'm such a wimp after many years away from Blighty, Really quite pathetic. I tell my server/owner/guy. No problem! He took it away and brought it back re done at a more acceptable spiceness. ( I'm pretty sure that's not a word, sorry). Delicious! Served with rice and a garlic naan. 

Wifee has Chicken Saag, she ordered 6/10 on the heat scale. Perfect!

Water was always topped up, drinks were offered frequently. Really great and we are going back. Often. 

Thanks Yuhi K.!!!!!

according to my indian roommate...this place is ok. however, when she is comparing the food to her mom's home cooking, that means the place is pretty legit. we stopped by to check out the lunch buffet. you can't really beat it for $8.99. lots of food....plenty of curries (veggie, chicken, lamb), samosas, buttered chicken, etc. the naan was really good, they brought it out piping hot from the kitchen. i'm not the best person to ask about indian food...but i thought it was good. so i would def come back. =)

Great family owned restaurant me and my family have been going to for 4 years. 
The staff are friendly and always  remember us. 
Best Indian food in Vegas

By far the worst dining experience 
Food not properly cooked.chicken tikka was raw!! Then they microwaved it and replated and served chewy and shriveled not good.   Place is not clean glass filled with water only to find bits of dust or cloth floating no table cloths sticky icky tables.not worth a dime to spend ..so please avoid visiting the restaurant. Not at all worth the 1 star rated

Really fresh, fancy and tasty lunch buffet. Loved the sweet rice, plus best galub jamun ever. Rich, sweet, moist. Friendly and attentive staff. Samosas, pakora, saag paneer - rich and nutty veggie sauce choices. $10.99 weekdays. Perfect alternative away from the crappy food on the Strip.

Just got finished eating at Mount Everest for their lunch buffet and I'm literally reeling in pain at my desk.  This opening line would work much better if you couldn't already see the 5 star rating I'm giving them.   Yes, this is that Sushi Mon all you can eat and then some, pants button undoing type of stomach pain, and not the having flashbacks of the Subway employee not washing his hands while making your Sweet Onion Teriyaki chicken sandwich type of pain.

I wish I could describe what I ate in detail, but the truth is I have no idea.  On the first plate I tried everything on the right side of the hot buffet items, which resulted in a plate of rice and an assortment of deliciously spiced veggie and chicken dishes along with some Veggie Samosas and Pakoras.  After a while, sauces were blending into each other, pakora were getting smothered with various other items, left became right, black became white, and soon a harmonious melting pot had been achieved on my plate that rivaled any buffet experience I've had.  With each bite I had no idea which item(s) I were eating, but they were all fantastic.  Some of these bites provided quite a kick and the quickly refilled iced tea and water were much appreciated.

I had no need for a 2nd plate.  I had no room for a 2nd plate.  Someone should have stopped me, but alas, they didn't.   Walking up to the buffet line, the only game plan I had was to try everything on the left side that I didn't try the first time.   Chicken Curry, Chicken something else, Chicken something else.  Done.  Unfortunately I also couldnt resist some more Daal, some more samosas, some more pakora.  3 bites in I knew I was in trouble.  12 bites in I started to hurt.  20 bites in I tapped out.   Now an hour later I'm finally starting to recover...

You may have won the battle Mount Everest, but I will be back to win the war.

Hands down the best Indian cuisine in Vegas.  Plakat Paneer (spinach & home made cheese) brings back incredible memories of Indian town in Singapore. ..doesn't get any more authentic than this. . And you can beat the $10.99 lunch buffet price!

This is the fourth time we have visited this place and it has been very consistent - and great. We're from out of town and this is one place we always visit. My wife is vegetarian but I will eat meat so we love this place.  

We typically get the baingan bharta and saag paneer. They have a spice level system of 1 to 10, we get 7 since we like a good kick to the food.  I like it really hot and had 8 once, which was hot and good for me but too much for my wife. She still loved it but had to eat slower.  7 from now on!  Naan is super fresh with nice crispy and soft textures. Samosas are crispy in the outside but not overdone, and fresh. Chicken Tikka also great. 

Service has always been attentive and friendly. It's a family run place and the owner is super nice.  We love this place and always look forward to come my back when in town.

The food here is excellent and authentic. We were looking for something affordable off the strip but good food and this place did not disappoint! We ordered garlic naan, chicken masala and prawn curry and it was ALL excellent. The staff was very friendly and fast. Dishes range in price from $11-14 and it's worth every dollar (if not more). It was exactly what we were looking for. 5 stars well deserved!

This restaurant has personalized service, excellent food. The owners are very friendly. They give free Indian bread with a meal. It is a small restaurant, and a former franchise. But it is a very nice opportunity to get an Indian buffet at a reasonable price. We recommend it to our friends.

This is our go-to dinner restaurant in Las Vegas for delicious Indian and Nepalese food. We over-order, so we can fight over the leftovers the next day.  Their food is always fresh, and perfectly flavored. The chutneys and sauces are great, too. Our out-of-town guests are always impressed with the food here. The staff is always welcoming and the service is above average. We love this place!

I have been eating Indian food since the 80's. At that time, in Nor Cal, there were no restaurants that I knew of, that served Indian food. I got my weekly fix at my BFF's house, courtesy of her mom. I drank chai almost daily as an after school treat. Her mom is vegetarian, so I always ate the same thing at her house: some type of dal, rice, yogurt and fresh made roti. Flash forward to today, and that is still pretty much what I eat when I go for Indian. 
We have only been to the buffet, so I can only base my review on the lunchtime offerings. I highly suggest that as you are being seated, you ask for garlic naan, if that is what you want. I stress, WHILE you are being seated. They are fast at this location and you will end up with plain naan if you don't speak quickly. They encourage you to start right away and your water will be waiting for you when you bring your first plate to your table. The naan will quickly follow. The samosa is vegetarian, along with a few other dishes. I have only had samosa, dal, rice, tandoori chicken, garlic naan, yogurt mixture and kheer. They are delicious. The only thing I would like to see is plain yogurt. I am not fond of the yogurt mixture, but I eat it because I cannot imagine eating  Indian food without yogurt... naan and/or roti. My man loves this place so much that he does not want to go back to Mint. I think Mint is good, but have had a plate get cold while I waited for my naan.
The staff is pleasant and the place is small, but has air conditioning.

Enjoy.

I've been coming to Mt Everest to get my Indian food fix for the past 5 years, and every single time I eat here I come away happy. I'm a vegetarian, and they have a superb list of veggie dishes. Some of my favorites are the paneer tikka masala, the malai kofta, the dal makhani and the palak paneer. One of my absolute favorite dishes here is one of their appetizers-the veggie momo. It's a supple dumpling filled with mixed veggies and spices, perfectly steamed, and served with a spicy dip. I dream about it. The owner is so down to earth and nice. He always recognizes me and my family and is so kind to us. I don't usually post reviews of places that I eat, but I'll definitely go out of my way to recommend this delicious restaurant. Give it a try!

i just loved the buffet, amazing food forget the buffet go here for lunch the food is amzing the breads are fresh and the service is amazing and very good variety of food and all tasting very nice :)

very impressed :)
Come here very often. Good service,, good food,, at good price. i like shahi paneer and mutter paneer.

Great food amazing staff and lots of parking and seating for families 
We ordered a variety of dishes and starters along with desert.
Must visit if u like indian food.

My boyfriend and I came here to try something new and let me tell you, I was kind of skeptical about it at first. But I am so happy we decided to give this place a try. This was the first time we had real authentic Indian food.

We ordered one of the Thali specials: Mount Everest India's Cuisine Special. Which was a platter of mixed appetizer, papadam (Indian chips) chicken tikka masala, dal makhani, palak panner, lamb curry, chicken tikka (4pcs), rice, naan, raita. When the platter came out, I honestly didn't know which was what, but everything was SO good!

We also had the Tandoori Chicken. This was my favorite dish we ordered. It was chicken baked in a clay oven, marinated in yogurt, garlic, ginger, herbs, and spices on an onion and bell pepper bed on a skillet. All the dishes were so flavorful from the spices. And the portions were huge! We ordered a lot for just us two and only spent $43. But we had yummy leftovers to take home. :)

Service was quick and friendly; always kept our waters full. They also have an all you can eat lunch buffet. Will be returning.

Excellent food and service!  Everyone's meal was delicious whether it was made super mild or extra spicy.  Super nice staff, they even gave us free dessert.  Price was also very reasonable.  This is a hidden gem.

Friend recommended we go to Mt after class she said it was cheap and tasty as a college student cheap is always good and I'm so glad she took me here BEST INDIAN FOOD IN TOWN!! The staff was also very friendly definitely coming back!

Best Indian buffet in Vegas hands down. I have been to all of them, and at Mt Everest you cannot beat the selection and the price. My neighbor and I come here about once a week and it is consistently superb. Super friendly staff as well!!! Centrally located, can't beat it!!!!!!

Whenever  feel like eating Indian Cuisine I/we ALWAYS come to Mount Everest because it really is THE VERY BEST LAS VEGAS HAS TO OFFER!!!! Tonight I had Lamb Biryani and a super hot Curry Sauce on the side, it was awesome as usual! I love the continuity of the food, texture, taste and presentation. The staff are always polite and very professional as well as friendly, and the owner is a real gentleman who knows how to treat his patrons.The ambiance in the restaurant is always pleasant, as is the Indian music that plays on TV monitors at an acceptable volume. Plenty of parking that is very well lit. Highly recommended!!!!!! J.D.

I LOVE this place!  I've eaten here many times and they've never disappointed.  The food is delicious - I almost always get the chicken tikka masala, but the chicken tandoori is to die for (spicy without being too much), and the naan (I've had garlic and regular) is fabulous.  Really, all the food I've had here has been excellent!

I also love their lunch buffet.  It's a good deal at $10.99, and there is always great variety.  I've been able to try many things that I would have never ordered (goat curry - yum!) but there are also always some of my favorites.  Their dinner menu is reasonably priced (especially with a Groupon) but the lunch buffet is definitely the deal to get if you're in the area at lunch time.

The first time I went the location was a little scary - it's on the corner next to a gas station and Mariana's supermarket and the outside is not super bright.  I was a little nervous, but as soon as I stepped inside I felt much better.  It is a cute place - tablecloths on the tables, well lit (not bright but definitely not "shady"), and the people are SO nice.  I've always had excellent service - definitely the nicest servers I've had in a long time!

I definitely highly recommend Mt. Everest!

The staff is exceptional. I don't think my water glass was empty once, and whenever I asked for more of something, it was on the table within minutes. A man who was either the owner or manager personally asked us how everything was, and even gave us free desserts after dinner. 

Overall, the food was great. The garlic chile naan was fantastic, toasty, fluffy and flavorful. The rice was cooked perfectly. The lamb vindaloo was phenomenal. The chicken tikka masala tasted a little different than I'm used to, but was still yummy. 

The only thing I was dissatisfied with was the aloo tikki. Typically, this is my favorite appetizer and I order it every single time I go to an indian place. Their aloo tikki was dry, hard, and lacking in flavor. 

I will be returning to try the lunch buffet.

This is the only Indian place I have ever been to and I have to say, it is the best! I have been here multiple times with my parents and every time I have been here the food is always amazing. The chicken tikka masala and their garlic naan are by far my favorites! Not to mention I am obsessed with the mango lassi! The service is always impeccable and everyone including the owner are lovely people. I can't wait to eat here again!

Somebody suggested Mint for the best Indian in Vegas, but they wanted to check this place out after hearing good things. It was okay, cost was $10.99 for a buffet and space is a bit small. Server was right there to greet us when we came in and sat us down at a table and told us to go up to the buffet.  

The first part of the buffet was all vegetarian items and I tried the Chana Masala, which was peas and potatoes in some curry and it was nice and hearty, but did leave a peculiar aftertaste. Nothing bad, but nothing familiar and I've had a lot of Indian food in my life. The samosas were huge, but some were lukewarm and didn't like that the exterior didn't get as puffy as they can. The pakoras were somewhat stale and awful! Boo.

All the meat options at buffet were chicken with the exception of goat curry. Favorite was the chicken makhani (Butter Chicken). Very good aroma and flavor and the meat was well cooked. I didn't enjoy the piece of Chili Chicken I decided to taste. Overly sweet and not enough balance. The tandoori was okay, but nothing memorable. Was excited to try the goat curry hidden in the far left back corner of the buffet and the small pieces of meat I was able to extract from the pool of curry was good, but there wasn't enough. Obviously somebody came around before and scooped up all the delicious pieces of meat and left the curry all sad and alone :( Even sadder they didn't refill the pan with some fresh goat curry.

Good food, but nothing amazing and I don't understand how this place got such high ratings. Too much good Indian cuisine in Sunnyvale has spoiled me, not to mention the months of Indian I feasted on while I lived in London. This was a letdown, but still an above average to good lunch buffet.

Dive into this incredible buffet 10 bucks. 5star   I love Indian, and they do it really great here, and you cannot beat the price.  Small place in the ghetto, sahara and valley view, not too ghetto, but still, its not pretty on this corner, but inside, you forget about it quick when you start salivating at the door, and running to the buffet like a wild animal ready to eat yourself silly.  Take a breath, its ok, this place will give you everything you need.   Every indian spice is in something, the quality and freshness is stellar!   Hightly recommended, just see the other reviews, dont take my word for it, try it and take you own word, its amazing!
Love coming here! Food is tasty (made vegan for me by request!), price is good, and the staff is courteous and helpful!  Trying gobi aloo tonight,  pix on my Instagram @fauxphox743

Comfort Food. Im a foodie and have literally eaten at all Indian Places in Las Vegas. I have eaten here since day one. And I have to say this is the best Indian food ever. I have taken many people here and now are regulars as well as friends from India , they told me that its like  real home cooked food. Love this place. I will always continue to come here and only here for Northern Indian food.

Love this place. It's always delicious, and the service is always stellar. Tonight I had veggie korma, which is great because it also comes with paneer chunks. I had a mango lassi and garlic naan, too. My husband and sister in law shared lamb korma and chicken tiki masala, and they loved their meals so much that they had no leftovers. I look forward to my korma later this evening or tomorrow for lunch!

My fave indian joint in vegas! Best lunch buffet ever! The food is always on point great selection and amazing service. The owner is always in the dinning room ensuring everyone is enjoying their meal! This place is fantastic ... everyone must try! Mmmmmmmmmmm

Cruising in my Lotus Elise rental, I wanted to get some good eats + a nice drive off the Strip. Indian food popped up and I dialed in this place.

The inside was a bit darker/cooler than I thought, with just the buffet lamps giving light besides the natural light. Still pretty nice, the food was great and the waiter/owner(?) was nice. When I asked them about not having rice kheer dessert, they said it rotates with other different items (that day had a mango dessert). Darn. To my surprise, he brings out a complimentary bowl of kheer. Awesome! It is one of my favorite desserts; so simple, yet so good. The naan is nice and fluffy, too.

Wow, very good food.  Impressive for sure.  We went with yelp on this, and it worked out.

Had to bump this up to 5 stars.  I am really shocked at the quality of food and the depth of flavor. 

The lunch buffet is considerably underpriced for what you get.  I suggest a heavy tip if you can, this needs to survive. 

Great service, friendly staff, and a family feel here. 

My new favorite lunch place.

Amazing food and the service outstanding! They owner even provided us free dessert and called us a cab to get back to the hotel. By the time we finished our dessert the cab was ready for us outside. My girlfriend and my 80 year old mom from Italy loved it! Thank you for a great meal, a charming restaurant that was easy to get to, and a lovely experience for the whole family.

This place is awesome!! Awesome food and awesome staff.  All the staff members are so kind and helpful.  The food is AWESOME!! The lunch buffet is perfect if you want to eat great, fresh food for lunch for a perfect price.  Dinner is awesome because there are so many different options to choose from.  Great place for vegetarians and people who love to eat meat. You have to try this place, you'll become addicted!

Being an ex-pat Brit, I've searched for many years for the best Indian restaurant in my adopted home. A couple of years ago I discovered this wonderful restaurant almost on my doorstep. At last I found my "go to" place for a curry away from "home". I come here nearly every week and of course it's nice to be warmly welcomed by the owner Prakash, and his staff and then to be treated so well. I and other members of my family have probably had everything on the menu but being a creature of habit, my favorites are: lamb saag, chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi, mushroom mutter masala, keema naan. These dishes are consistently fabulous. Other notables include the tandoori mix grill, kadai chicken and chicken pakora. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough. Between the outstanding food and wonderful service I believe it is the very best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas.

HANDS DOWN BEST Indian food in the city! To not come here and try it at least once is doing yourself a serious disservice! I have been coming here for over three years and the food is consistent, authentic, and bursting with flavor every time! 


What a gem!
The service here is really good! The owner gave us many different flavored naan to try out! The food is also good too, especially the chicken masala! Love this restaurant!
Very good food! Nice crew! Recommend this place to everyone who likes indian cuisine!
Great service. Delicious food. Affordable. Don't expect it to look fancy inside.... But it hits all other requirements.

I have been going here with my Bangladeshi friend for over a year.  I found it while going shopping at the Mexican market next door (didn't buy anything, kinda crappy selection, but I was looking for a horchata).  Anyway, it is not a large selection for a buffet.  But the items that they have are very good.  There is half for vegetarians and half for meat eaters.  I usually get a lot of the tandori chicken and lamb with curry. Their dessert rice pudding of some sort is pretty dang good too.  I think it is a staple of most Indian restaurants but they do it well here.  I usually grab 2 co-workers and use buy 2 get 1 free coupon and pig out once per month during lunch hours.  Dinner is the same but they dont have the buffet.

The place is clean and the nan bread comes out hot. I told my friends this was a hole in the wall, and it is on the outside, but inside is tastefully done.  On the wall is the obligatory Indian dramas who dance away the whole time you are eating.
We really enjoyed the food. Great flavor throughout the meal. The chicken dishes were moist - fork cut, and the lamb we had was well prepared. This is a little gem of an Indian joint

I'm no expert on Indian cuisine, but I've been to numerous Indian restaurants (Pioneer St. in Cerritos anyone?) that I can distinguish the good from the bad. 

My wife and I saw the high ratings on yelp and decided to give this place a try. 

Unfortunately, we didn't quite reach the summit on this place in terms of our satisfaction, but this is based on just one try.

Lamb samosas- Too dry. 
Chicken Tikka Masala- Not the most flavorful masala we've had. Felt like something was missing. 
Lamb Curry- This was my favorite dish. The lamb was super tender, and the curry sauce was savory with the right amount of spice. 

Service was outstanding throughout and that made the experience a more enjoyable one. 

We'll definitely be back to Mount Everest again and hopefully reach the top then.

The outside of the restaurant does no justice to the restaurant. If I had not read the reviews, we would turn and drive away. I have been here for Buffett and it was pretty good with a very nice lamb curry. Tonight we are here for a take out. Unfortunately we waited for over 30min for our food. Like all Indian foods, the potions are surprisingly small during dinner specially if you are used to Indian buffets. The quality of the food is good. Overall I rather go to Indian when they have Buffett.
Delicious lunch buffet for 12 bucks. Good variety and fresh food. I will return.

I kept hearing good things about this place so I was excited to come here. I must have come on an off day because nothing really stood out for me. The Tandoori chicken was too dry and bland. The different types of curries were a little watery and didn't have the right levels of spice and flavor. The naan was mediocre and I didn't even finish the samosa. I can't name one thing that I enjoyed from the buffet. 

This place was super crowded when I went. I went on a Tuesday and the line was out the door and some people were standing next to our booth partially blocking us so I was felt trapped. No complaints about the service. I probably won't be back though unless someone else is paying and really wants to go.

Wow!  The first sign that Mt. Everest was going to be a good restaurant was the complex scent of spices that hit our noses.  The next sign was that it was crowded...and most of the customers were Indian.

We had chicken curry and kauli aloo and found them to be fragrant, tasty, and freshly prepared.  The garlic naan was great.

The staff was friendly and prompt. The prices were more than reasonable.
Excellent Indian Food!! Had Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka and Lamb Jalfezi with 10+ heat... Excellent flavor.. And it burned so good!! I love really spicy food, this place is awesome!!
Awesome. Food was delicious affordable and came out quick. Prakash the owner was friendly and ready to make suggestions about what to order and the service was great.
The food is authentic and so good!  My husband I love coming here. The naan bread is amazing!

Just as fantastic as my last visit.  Great food, flavor was awesome, spice was out of this world.  My only suggestion would be to turn the A/C on.  The warm weather combined with the spice of the food makes for an uncomfortable visit.

After seeing the great reviews on Yelp, I decided to try out Mount Everest India's Cuisine. I had never tried Indian food before, and wanted to try something new for dinner so I brought along my two buddies for the ride. 

Upon arriving, we were greeted with quick and prompt service, which was a very big plus in my book. All the workers there were very kind, and quickly assisted us with whatever we needed. My friends and I wanted to try different things and share, so we ordered a prawn curry, chicken biriyani, garlic naan, and a very very spicy chicken biriyani.

When the food arrived, I felt like I was in heaven! Everything smelled so good and looked so flavorful, I immediately started to dig in. 
-The garlic naan was amazing, and felt like it just melted in my mouth. I even ordered another round because it was SO GOOD. 
-The prawn curry was the right amount of spicy for me and very delicious. It was big enough for us to split between 3 people.
-The chicken biriyani was very flavorful and had tender chunks of chicken mixed inside. It was definitely something I would order again!

My first trip to an Indian restaurant was a good one. I hope to come back sometime soon and try out something new!

Decent food and service. Tried the lunch buffet -- good selection of traditional veg and non-veg Indian dishes including Tikka masala, Tandoori Chicken, Goat Curry and plenty of Paneer based veg choices. Good flavors, great aromas, tasty dishes. 

There are not a lot of good Indian restaurants in Las Vegas, but Mount Everest certainly serves up a good meal.  I recommend giving it a try.

New in Nevada, and my girlfriend took me here. Never had India's cuisine food and OMG let me tell you it was amazing. I completely fell in love with the chicken Makhani and garlic chili Naan so delicious. I highly recommend this spot! Service was great and friendly and the price was very reasonable.
It's all already been written, this place is amazing and such a good value. Hooray for Chicken Makhani and Indian music videos playing all the time!

This place is great. The food is excellent and we were served by the owner (he was very nice). I talked my husband into trying a different cuisine and he was weary about the place from the looks on the outside; if it was not for the open sign we probably would not have stopped. The inside is very nice, linen on the tables and clean. We are early eaters so we were the start of their dinner crowd, it filled up quickly as we ate. 

We ordered the garlic Naan and it was awesome, made to order. My husband had the Lamb Korma on my recommendation and I had the Chicken Korma. They also have a veggie Korma that is probably just as good. Portion sizes are large.

Don't judge a book by its cover or you will miss out on some really outstanding Indian Cuisine. My husband liked it so much he wants to go back before we leave Las Vegas. That does not happen often and means he really liked it as did I.

I am just wondering how this place got more than 4 stars!!

We were in Vegas last week and were craving for good Indian food, this was the first Indian restaurant that popped up in the search and had pretty good reviews which we trusted. The experience was far from good right from the start with bad/dirty ambience and sloppy service to food that tasted nothing like it should. 

This was one of the worst Indian food that I have had in US.

As with many cuisines I am not a Indian expert at all, to be honest I have only been to two different places and I can't tell you off the top of my head specific dishes that are must have for me which is why my photos for this place aren't labeled yet cause I had to take a pic of my receipt to know what I tried .. So I will update that later (I hope)

My current S/O loves Indian which is why I discovered thiS Vegas gem..since being introduced to Indian I've decided it is a fun way to eat with people who are open to a variety of dishes.. As stated I can't tell you what you should try and get here because I'm ignorant on this cuisine .. I know from this visit that I love love their chicken Momo.. I also learned some dishes I don't like but that is trial by fire or if you dine here and the manager / server notices a pretty full plate he offers you something else to go which ... Hey  I don't know indian yet but I do feel I am very versed in good quality and amazing service ..

Price wise this place isn't cheap but I didn't find it expensive for what you get , overall it's worth the drive to come to Everest from the north side of town but if you're in the area and want some delicious yum Yum food like the masala or garlic naan check this place out !!! I've only been for dinner so I can't speak for the buffet or lunch service ..

Family owned and operated. Extremely nice and attentive service. Was visiting Vegas with my Nepali wife and mother-in-law. We went there for the buffet on our first day in Vegas(they were packed). After the lunch experience, we made sure to visit on our last night for their dinner. Both my other-in-law and wife were impressed, and can be difficult for my mother-in-law. The quality of food was  every bit as good as many Indian cuisines I have paid much more for. The lunch buffet I would give 8/10. Options were more than the typical Indian buffet I visit. They are generous with their meat portions, and quality as well. The dinner steps up the class a bit from lunch but with reasonable pricing still. Some may find the Indian TV music station playing in the background a bit distracting, but we found that it added to the ambiance. The food quality and spice complexity was improved over the lunch selection. The portions were large. We shared an order of momo(dumplings) and 2 entrees between 3 people and had leftovers. The momo was just as good as we get in Nepal, but that makes sense as the place is owned and operated by a Nepali family. If you know anything about Nepal, you know the reputation they have as being kind and hospitable people.

From the outside it doesn't look like much so we were a little nervous about eating there but after reading the reviews we decided to give it a try. The chicken tikka masala was delicious, as was the garlic naan. The service was great and our server was friendly and very attentive.Would definitely recommend.
Best Indian Food in Las Vegas!  I lived in England for a while where Indian food was predominant and I am so happy to have found this place in Las Vegas.  Service is also great!

My wife and I stopped by this place as we were craving some Indian food during our Vegas trip. The decor is fairly simple and to the point. The food however was excellent!! We had the baingan bartha and dal makhani and it was the best baingan and dal I have had. Coming from Dallas, we have our fair share of Indian restaurants but the simplicity and taste of food here simple blew us away. 

This is a must visit for Indian food lovers anywhere!

I don't why this hotel is rated high. It's a Pathetic restaurant . Actually I am right now in the restaurant. They have a buffet lunch. Once I took the curries I was told I will get the naan but I had to wait 30mins until I went and ask for it again. Atmosphere sucks. I would better have gone to some gas station and got Pringles.

It seems like I spend most of my life in this place and for good reason. The food is amazing, I've tried almost all Indian restaurants in Las Vegas and have been eating Indian food for over 30 years. This place is the best in town. Highly recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala and Kadai Chicken. That said all dishes are great, even veggies dishes are delicious. They also have a lunch buffet 7days per week, which is also dangerously delicious! A real festival for the taste buds! ;)
Food is good. Suggestion - make it easy for the customers to order food.. such as have an option to order a basket of breads vs. Ordering them individually.. same thing with starters..

Had a dinner for two here during a weekday and ordered their Mount Everest Thali special for $21.99.  It was just the right amount of food for heavy eaters like us but would probably be too much for the average appetite.  The quality is above average and quite enjoyable, kinda like good home cooking.  The restaurant was quite clean and the service was friendly and prompt despite the restaurant being more than half occupied.  I can't recommend getting their thali combos enough.  It's like getting a tasting menu as you'll get quite a good variety of staple Indian dishes. Overall, I'd eat here again.  You get so much eating satisfaction for the money.

This was a really great place to go with my bestie!  We love to try lots of things and at the lunch buffet price who could argue!  It is a small place and I wondered how come there wasn't a line to eat this yumminess!  We went around 1pm to miss the lunch rush...I think we did right :)  Can't wait to go back

Moving on up! In case you don't know, Indian lunch buffet is a major food group for me. Currently, the Everest is the pinnacle of options. We discovered they recently changed chefs, and you can tell! New, tastier and spicier dishes, and  my fave saag in town. Some saag carries the spinach flavor a little too heavy, but here it is beautifully spiced. Plus, they have no problem preparing roti for us. Buffet bliss!

We were all craving Indian one night in Vegas (we were staying a little off the strip) and decided to order take out from this place, because of the great reviews. SO happy we did, the food was delicious (Chicken Tikka Masala, naan, etc.) with a good amount of chicken in the dishes and plenty of rice to have left-overs for the next day. AND we even came back later that week, because we couldn't get enough of the great food. Really nice owner too!

Came here with a big group and thought the service wasn't great (but that might have been because they were really busy at the time).  I've had way way better indian food though the people at my table who ordered the chicken tikka masala said it was really good.
I am here every Tuesday for my chicken makhni and masala chai tea.Great food! Full of flavor.
Average food really. Their best Item was probably the chicken makhani and gulab jamuns. Palak paneer, chickpea curry, chicken curry and lamb curry were all average. Not returning back

This is our second visit here. The first visit was really good but our second visit was amazing! We had the Chicken Mo Mo, kinda like pot stickers which we were told were a Nepalese specialty. Great start to our entres. We order the Chicken Makhani and the Chana Masala. The Masala was really good but holy shit, the Makhani was the best thing we have eaten in a long time. We asked for a to go menu to jot down some notes for next visit. 
Ownership and employees were extremely nice and offering suggestions and servicing special requests as my wife is pregnant. 
This is a must visit! WE WILL BE BACK!
Solid Indian buffet place. Good variety of meat and non-meat dishes. Everything tastes freshly made. Staff is... What you normally expect at Indian restaurant.

My friend and I just ate the lunch buffet here, honestly I was blown away! This place is great from the chicken masala to the mint sauce.. I was hesitant because a lunch buffet doesn't usually sound appetizing but they hit home! Thanks for a great meal, we will definitely be back!

We visited this place for lunch buffet based on reviews from Yelp after a long tiring road trip (Yeah we were very very hungry). Too overrated. We didnt find anything special. Everything was just mediocre. They didnt have many choices. I would not go go again.

Awesome food and great service, just like in India where they make you feel at home. The nepali momos are a big hit, again just like back home. Strongly suggest the goat curry, chicken Tikka masala and yellow daal. Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas.

We've been here for dinner several times and tried out the lunch buffet.  

If you're going for the lunch buffet, try to plan around traditional lunch times because it gets BUSY and there is about 3 square feet of waiting area directly in front of the door.  

That being said, this is our favorite Indian food restaurant so far.  The service is maybe a little slow (even when they are not busy), but the food is worth it.  The hubs sticks to the standard tikka masala, but we've had the Jel Frezi and Vindaloo as well.  Everything was fantastic.  

The lunch buffet is a great way to sample a bunch of their foods too.  

We'll definitely be going back for more!

So from the outside, this place looks shady and like an Indian food restaurant you would not want to set foot it. I am pretty sure it was a Wendy's or Burger King building before. Go in and eat...you will not regret it.

The $10 lunch buffet is so good. A little on the creamy side, but the food is spectacular. There are a lot of choices, vegetarian and meat and everything has usually (one bad dish once) tasted really good. They even have good Indian beer to help wash it all down.

The service is quick and easy. We were in a hurry once and got through the lunch buffet in like 25 minutes from walking in the door to paying.

Aug 4th update... still the one to beat. Fresh, tasty, attention to detail, but it's the food. The food is varied and fresh and quite flavorful. It looks like a hole-in-the-wall from the outside, but it's all about the food and value for me. This is one place I almost ALWAYS sample when I'm in town. Worth a short trip from the Strip.

Great food! Great service! What more do you need! I don't really like Indian food but this place was awesome! The chicken tiki Marsala And the chicken korma were both fantastic! And don't forget to get your rice pudding! Overall highly recommended!

Up until now I never really liked Indian food, especially a buffet.  Everything just seemed soggy, overcooked and old.  THIS restaurant however,  is completely the opposite of my preconceived notion. 

We went for the lunch buffet.  It was amazing.  Everything was fresh and hot.  A very good selection of both vegetarian and meat dishes.  Most everything I tried was absolutely delicious.  I went back for seconds and even thirds.  The next day, I came back for more!  

The restaurant was clean, the decor tasteful and comfortable.  The price was very good too. 

Careful though, all that curry can get to you.  ;)

Mt. Everest is a great find and we were really impressed with the caring service from Prakass and food.  We had Chicken Tikka Masala (fabulous) we were eating the sauce by itself when the chicken was gone, Rogan Josh (lamb) was tender and NO FAT.  The Naan bread was fluffy and crispy.  I'm not a beer drinker but our server Prakass suggested that we try the Indian beer, Taj Mahal.  Loved it. The food portions are generous as well.   Will definitely return
Great food, good vibes. The onion bread was off the charts! Go for lunch and enjoy the buffet. The samosas, oh the samosas!

The chicken tiki masala is delicious and the servers were so nice.  When we first pulled up we were not so sure because it looks small and old and in an older area but once you got inside it was ok and smelled so good.

Right off, I'm very stingy with giving out stars and I'm not likely to assign any value to the outside of any place.  This restaurant is not much to look at from the outside but is a medium to small restaurant that is pleasantly decorated inside with a friendly staff.  The lunch buffet is served in some of the nicest heated tables (one iced table for the cold menu) with covered chafing dishes.  The food is kept hotter than any other buffet with dishes refreshed regularly.  The one meat table is separate from the vegetable tables, a nice feature for vegetarians to avoid cross contamination.

Every dish was delicious.  Although I would have liked to have one main potato dish (there were potato samosas and a great mixed vegetable dish with potatoes) and would drop up to half a star for the menu selection, the food was fresh, perfumed, and not overly South Indian hot.  The obligatory Tandoori Chicken was both flavorful and moist.  I suspect that the heated tables and covered chafing dishes help maintain the quality of the food.  The pakora were a little crunchy, maybe not perfect, but tasty.  Given that there are no half-stars, the only negatives were not worthy of dropping to four stars considering our overall satisfaction.

We arrived for a late lunch, around 1:30, but the food was great and refreshed before the dish was emptied, keeping the quality up.  The plain naan arrived before we were back from the buffet and I would have liked to have garlic naan, but no one asked.  I guess it is important to ask right away for naan other than plain, but the plain naan was good.  The service was fine with dishes cleared and water refilled, but a little invisible and surprisingly shy.  For any questions, just call out for them -- they really don't want to disturb your meal.

Overall, the fixtures were superior, the dining room was kept clean, and every dish on the buffet was terrific.  Not quite the huge selection found in some of the buffets in Silicon Valley, but it was all good.  Hard to believe that any other Indian buffet in Vegas will beat this spot for quality and value, this is now our go-to Indian restaurant for Vegas.
The food here is pretty good. Coming from a guy who enjoys spicy food, it's pretty good for the balance between flavorful spice and spice that hurts to eat.
Food was amazing and I would totally go again! Plus it's so much cheaper than anywhere else!:-)
This place is prefect place for Indian food, the food is really authentic Indian food. Ask for spicy and you will get it. Naan and samosa are great

Of all the Indian places in Vegas... this is a frequent stop for me! I am pretty stuffed and satisfied everytime after dining here.  The restaurant seems like a family owned business and the customer service is wonderful!! They are super nice, friendly, and seem easy to get their attention if you need anything. There's also a TV playing in the corner with current Indian movies with plenty of bollywood dancing and hip current Indian music.  

The usual dishes we order are: 
 - appetizers: vegetable pakora and samosas, thinly spiced cracker (don't know the name of it - sorry)
 - main dishes : tandoori chicken, palak paneer, chicken korma, chicken makhani, lamb curry (rogan josh)
 - sides: garlic naan and rice

The appetizers are very tasty and a good size that come with a mint jutney sauce and a spicier sauce.  All the main dishes are very good also.  Warning though, if you ask for spicy... these dishes can definately make you sweat like a banshsee!! just ask my bf!! I like them milder and ask for mild or a level "3" and they are delish.  Maybe "5" or higher will be too spicy and possibly not enjoyable... but up to one's palate.  The tandoori chicken comes out on a sizzling plate and the chicken is so tender and tasty, always a safe bet.  The chicken makhani (butter chicken) is my absolute favorite! The korma and curry are pretty rich in spices and have very distinct flavors to the dishes.  I think the palak paneer is alright but reminds me more of creamed spinach - so maybe a pass.  

This place is small and cozy but usually hopping with customers.  The food may come out a bit slower when they are busy but it's worth the wait.  Always happy with the food and service here that makes me keep coming back for my Indian food fix!!  I really need to come for the lunch buffet which looks like a great deal for the same food.

I love this place!! This is my 4th time coming here. I live near Henderson and it's worth the drive and traffic. I'm 9 months pregnant and am craving spicy lamb curry With mix vegetables. It smells so delicous in here and outside. The customer service is amazing as always. The place is clean and the ambiance is relaxing especially after having a hected day. Will continue my loyalty at this restaruant!

Prakash, who I believe to be the owner, greeted us immediately after being seated. He was extremely helpful and I'm sure that a noobie could be easily accommodated by Prakash. His place is about what you would expect from a cozy neighborhood restaurant. It's not like a joint located in the strip. Thank goodness. My friend had the Lamb Tiki Masala. I had the Chicken Tandoori. Both plates were amazing! The Bread we ordered was Kabouli Naan and garlic Naan. My buddy had a Mango Lassi for his drink. The Rice Pudding finished us off. Mount Everest is completely deserving of its Yelp standing. Indian food now is at the top of my list right next to Vietnamese. I can't wait to return the next time I'm in Vegas. Do yourself a favor and go here. Tell Prakash Trent sent you!

I've been to Mount Everest about a dozen times and have never been disappointed. I don't go anywhere else for Indian Food in Vegas.

Atmosphere: Great Mom & Pop shop, clean, nice culture and music.
Service: Excellent: They probably fill up my water glass 8 times during the meal whenever its half empty!
Now to the good stuff, the food:

The food is consistent every time I go in and is large portions. The prices are reasonable. The food is always extremely hot and can be adjusted by spice level. The raita is a good way to go with the garlic naan. Also the crackers with indian chutneys at the beginning of the meal are complimentary and great.

Chicken tikka masala is unreal! Check this place out, you won't be disappointedf! Thanks, Prakash and Mt. Everest :)
I love the food here, and the service is always stellar. The owner, Prakash, is always present and proud in this great local restaurant

The lunch buffet is diverse and delicious. 
They have beer which is a fine accompaniment to the cuisine.

Prakash and his staff continue to prove that they have the best, most authentic and welcoming Indian and Nepalese Restaurant in Las Vegas. Prices are always very reasonable for the portions provided, and the staff is happy to tailor the level of spice to any palate without losing the key flavors. The atmosphere of the restaurant is always warm and welcoming with soft lighting and a real ceiling with better acoustics for a good talk over a meal (rather than the new fad at restaurants of a large cavernous warehouse ceiling and raucous noise requiring you to shout at your dinner companion.) My personal favorites are the momo, the butter chicken, the paratha, and the mango lassi, but every dish we have tried is of the highest quality and flavor. I highly recommend Mt. Everest to all my closest friends and visitors to Vegas who want to get away from the Strip for something different that tastes wonderful!
Great service and delicious food!  Fulfilled my friend's and my own craving for Indian food.

As a kid I used to hang out with a lot of guys from Sri lanka and Malaysia and this place reminded me of the food they made.  I didn't look at the menu much on this visit because that buffet called to me, teasing my nose like a cartoon depiction of the smell of food tickling Scooby's nose.  The curry selection here is fantastic and so are all the other dishes on the buffet.  This is definitely my favorite Indian cuisine restaurant now and I will come here anytime my better half lets me lol.

I wanted to stray from cuisine I was already familiar with, so I grabbed a handful of friends who were up for something new and came here after looking at some reviews. It was our first time trying Indian food, and I have to say, I do quite like it!

An $11 lunch buffet is a great price. There's a lot of room in there, and there is variety in the dishes from what I can tell. I spooned a little bit of everything on my plate and nearly everything I tried I was a fan of. The naan came, and the garlic naan was as good as everyone on Yelp had said. My friends were also fans of the sweet rice. I think it paired perfectly with the chicken curry.

The service was awesome, too! Being first timers, they were all very helpful. They made more sweet rice for us even when they were around 10 minutes away from closing and didn't hesitate to let us know what the fennel was for by the entrance. Lol. Overall, this place is a great experience for those who want to try it!

We had the most amazing butter chicken!  The naan was out of this world, but the gulab jamun was unbelievable especially when paired with rice pudding. Do yourself a favor and go there NOW. I don't care if it's closed; go there NOW and wait for it to open- you'll thank me later!!!
The owner is very friendly and service  is exceptional. The food is delicious, wether it's buffet or menu food.

I've been eating at Everest for a couple of years now. Their food has always been the ideal comfort food. I quit going to Mint because the experience at Everest couldn't be topped! 

That said, what is going on with this place!? I haven't seen the owner in months. I visited on Sunday and though they have 4 people working the dining room, service is a disaster. You have to beg for water and napkins. My water was refilled once in the whole visit, but the check was promptly delivered before we finished eating. 

The food quality is WAY down. I couldn't cut the chili chicken with a knife, it was dried to jerky. My favorite, richly flavored makhani is now a strangely over spiced lackluster sauce. 

The overall quality has taken a major hit in the owner's absence. I can only hope he returns and whips that place into shape!

A colleague and I changed our business lunch venue to Mount Everest today - and I'm sooooo glad we did!

I love Indian food - and haven't had any in a while other than the boil-in-a-pouch variety from Trader Joe's so I jumped at the chance to try a place in town I hadn't been to before. Just pulling up and waiting outside the aroma was so enticing - I could tell good things awaited.

Of course, since we were there for lunch - we got the buffet. As someone who primarily eats vegetarian/vegan I was immediately impressed with the number of veggie dishes offered - and I loved the fact that they separated the meat dishes into a different station all together. Everything I loaded up my plate with was delish!  From the basmati rice, dal, veggie korma, samosas and pakoras - everything was outstanding. The service was super kind and prompt too!  I'll be back - with my husband in tow next time!
The portions were larger than we expected, the mango lassi was delicious, and they have a huge variety of dishes on their menu. :)

I'm no Indian food expert but you can stamp my Indian food non-expert seal of approval for Mount Everest. It is an All You Can Eat Indian buffet with all sorts of Indian dishes for just $10.99.  Believe me when this very reasonable price of $10.99 is worth way more than the price you pay. Each time I've been here for lunch it's been packed with people spilling out while waiting for tables to free up.  There's even not a lot of parking.  Most of the time these are good signs of how delicious a place is and this was the case here. Is it authentic Indian? I wouldn't know but a few of my vo-workers from India like them too, though I haven't seen others from India dine here at the same time as me.

I never asked what a dish was or what's inside so all I can say is that I enjoyed them all, the green stuff, the orange stuff, the yellow and brown stuff, the stuffed bread stuff, and the fried battered stuff, all very delicious. They were labeled but I don't remember what each was because I usually sample them all. There was a red chicken, not to be mistaken for char sui, and another meat dish. Ask for the Garlic Naan, the freshest right out of the oven?? the better.  They do have non-buffet options.

It use to be a Burger King so imagine that kind of space on the inside and they have a TV playing films from India. Customer service is usually fast and friendly so the only reason that I think there's a long wait is because they are very good and those there first are enjoying the goods.

Not bad. Closest Indian restaurant to Summerlin, unfortunately. The price is great for what you get. Not the best but acceptable for a quick lunch. The waitstaff could be a little more attentive as well as wear matching uniforms or shirts to show who they are. They were dressed like customers.
Really good food, friendly staff.  The cheese naan and tikka masala are awesome.  I've been there several times now and will definitely go back. Small cozy room, good prices for the quality.
I like the atmosphere and the way the people who are working  are very attentive the food is really good and it is a good place to try if you want somewhere that's quiet and nice to eat

Great place all around. Have enjoyed everything I've tried here. The Chicken Kadai is my go to main dish, though the butter chicken is excellent as well. Garlic naan is very good but the star of the place is the Chicken Momo's. I am huge fan of all different kinds of dumplings but have to say these are amongst my favorite. Many times I just get 2 orders to go on my way home. Overall fantastic place that I highly recommend

I just moved into this neighborhood and had heard a lot of great things so I stopped in for dinner. Wow. What an awesome place! I have tried a few other well regarded places but I think I found my new favorite! The lamb jalfrezi and chau chau soup were excellent! As was the garlic naan. I also liked that as a person who eats a lot of spicey food they matched my spice level request perfectly!
Lovely Indian place. We were initially a little hesitant since the outside doesn't look that appealing, but the ambiance inside, as well as the food, was wonderful! Recommend the veg. momos!

Myself and a bunch of coworkers go here for the lunch buffet and it always pleases. A decent amount of options for a reasonable price. I've yet to have a bad experience, the food is great and the service is good too. I definitely recommend it.

Mixed emotions. Fascinating flavors conspire with humble decor to create a modest yet intriguing experience. As many others have noted, the dishes are flavorful. But there are a few cons to this place as well, the service being the biggest one (minus our water host, as he was attentive enough to become manager). Other staff acted as if Mom and I hardly existed, most likely due to large lunch parties.

Pros: Great food, decent selection of dishes for the buffet

Cons: Very inattentive staff (especially if large parties are dining, and you're a party of 1-4), selection could be a little bigger

Went to this place after reading rave reviews on yelp. Was there for lunch buffet, their menu (vegetarian dishes) was so disappointing. Their gravies lacked flavor. The two stars are only for their bread (garlic naan) it was so soft and fresh. 
PS: if you are there to try their veg dishes be prepped to get disappointed!

Ok all you Yelpers and non-Yelpers... although I have not really left a review before - here it goes.

After spending 25 years in a part of the country where Indian food ( great food at that ) was as common as a Starbucks - I got used to my week having curry stains on my fingers, and then it happened, I moved.... and moved to a place that not only did not have Indian food, but the town had not one red light, nor anyone who liked THAT type of food. Uggggggggg.

Then on a trip to Las Vegas, I found Mt. Everest, and fell in love!

The wonderful people there understand what great food, friendship, and service is. I had even left a book there and they held on to it for over a week until I could return. I wonder if it was my subconscious having me forget it so that I had to go back for another wonderful experience. Yummmmmmm !!!

To top it off, they even called me a cab. I felt like royalty, and left knowing that I have not only found the best food in Vegas, but that I had also made friends. 

I will soon be moving my business to Vegas, and know that when I return there is a place with friends, and great food, to come to anytime I get the urge.

If you are looking for a wonderful experience, and don't want to make a mistake about where to eat - This Place Rocks!

Great service! Super friendly staff . Food was steaming hot ! We ordered the spicy lamb dish and potato stuffed naan . The rice was perfectly cooked . We've tried a lot of different Indian restaurants all over the u.s & this is by far one of the best !

This is some of the best Indian food in Las Vegas, hands down.
Don't let the area put you off...you'll be inside anyway!!
The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food...YUM!!! It is perfectly spiced, just the right amount of heat. The fried foods are not greasy, the lamb is not gamy. The Mattar Paneer, the pacoras,the veggie samosas, the naan...WOW!!
Mount Everest is THE place for Indian Cuisine in Las Vegas!!

This is THE best Indian food in Las Vegas and the best service. We come at least twice a week now and for us it's a thirty minute drive. It's worth it! It's family owned and we feel like family being there. Today we were brought complimentary desert (carrot and rice pudding) that we would of never ordered on our own. It was outstanding!!! We always get their options of vegetarian curries and the fried rice and garlic naan. The fried rice is ridiculously good with fresh peas, sweet onions, cashews, and raisons. We highly recommend this hidden gem and wish we could give them much more credit than a yelp review because it's always such an amazing dinner and experience!
Came for lunch on xmas day 2016. The buffet is 10.99 and the food is yummy. Very flavorful. The naan was very soft.

My husband and I must have gone here on a REALLY off day for them. :/ We ate at the AYCE lunch buffet and I felt like we were eating their scraps. Food wasn't hot...just warm enough to eat. The chicken and lamb was dry. They forgot our drink orders and then when they finally did come out, they got our order wrong. The food was just ok...some of it was not edible though. I hate wasting food, so I usually eat it if I don't think it's the best...but some of it, I just couldn't eat because it was either too dry or just didn't taste right. I hate to say it but I would never come back here again, especially since we have found better.

I have eaten at Indian restaurants around the US including Missouri, IL, IN, WI and CA. 

Everest in Las Vegas is probably the finest. It's the food I used to eat at home and not like the restaurant food other restaurants serve. The food at Everest is simple and delicious. You can taste how fresh the ingredients are. The chutneys smell and taste of cilantro - which is only possible if it's made fresh. 

Their naan is the best. Make sure to order it. 

I can't say more about the restaurant other than - if you are in town, give Everest a try. You'll love it.

DOWNGRADED

went back yesterday for the lunch buffet and it was seriously disappointing. 

the food wasn't as good as it use to be (before the place got popular). the food seemed to lack the love and attention it use to receive.  much of the buffet items weren't even refilled, one of them just had sauce left, ALL THE MEAT WAS GONE. (f.y.i i even checked before i left to see if it was refilled and still NOTHING.)

service wasn't all that great either. the owner was busy on the phone the whole time, didn't give much attention to his customers.

what was good before WCAP (went cheap after popularity):
+ we use to be seated and now he just points to a table for use to go to.
+ we use to get our water refilled without having to ask and now i have to wave down the waiter. 
+ we use to get the bill brought to the table, now we have to go up to the cashier
+ the rice pudding dessert use to actually have the consistency of pudding and now its super runny

FINAL NOTE: you can try this place if you've never tried it before, its not horrible but it wasn't what it use to be. BUT if you have ate here before, stay away or you'll be just as disappointed in them as i was. (never going back, goodbye mt. everest)

we had a short vacation to vegas this year and Mt. Everest was the best thing that happened to us! we had both the lunch buffet and dinner here and was one of the best indian food places my wife and I have ever been to in the US! their naan and paneer dishes were made from scratch and you can taste the fresh ingredients cooked to perfection! service was great and the owner too was very friendly. i really look forward to visit this place again on our next trip. indian food lovers this place is a MUST VISIT during your vegas trip!
Fabulous experience!  Food was perfect and service was even better.  Will come again next time we're in town!

This review is really for how they set their price point with regards to children. I've been a regular  here since my kids were 4 and 6 yrs old and now they are 6 and 8 yrs old. The problem I have is this, they don't tell you much kids pay for buffet. In the past I've only paid half so I thought that's okay,  when I came here this weekend I paid full price for both of my kids even though they did not eat as much as me and my wife and so I wondered. Any other buffet restaurants in Vegas they would have paid half price, since they are just kids. Most restaurants (casino or not) based their pricing on children's age, if your kid is over 11 or 12 they pay full and so on and so forth. I asked the guy who took my payment on why my kids pay full price when they are 6 and 8. He told me they based the price on how much a kid should pay based on much they eat, I say what??That is ridiculous, what if my kid is not a big eater, how can they assess this, by putting their plate on a weighing scale? I feel like I was scammed and for that this restaurant just lost a long time and loyal customer. It's misleading, I might even think of bringing a complain to BBB. Going somewhere else next time, for everyone else please be warn, if you bring your kids you don't know how much you will be paying. Should have went to SURA korean BBQ, half price for kids, more selections and cheaper overall!

Can't believe I haven't reviewed.  The awesome guy I order from called me out on it today -  considering how often I come to this joint,  it was time for their five stars.  

Attentive service.  Solid Indian food.  Wonderful lunch buffet.  Great to-go service.  I'm never disappointed with my visit. Sad they simplified their menu.  It's super simple to point and order,  but I do miss seeing the full name of what I'm ordering.

I came back to try the lunch buffet and yup....they did not disappoint! :)

Everything was DELICIOUS! :) I especially loved the goat :) so tender and no trace of "goatiness" if you were worried about that.  Lol ;) 

There was not one thing that I would change except the size of my stomach.  :) I wanted to eat more BUT my stomach pleaded please no more!!! So I had to stop eating.  Lol

And all the food for only $10.99...is a steal. But I would recommend coming on a day that u are not working.  I'm at the gym now trying to get over the food coma trying to work off some of that yumminess. :D

And yes there are no pics because I was too hungry to take pics.  So come on by and take your own pics.  Lol

I haven't been here in about a year, but in that time, Mt. Everest India Cuisine, hasn't lost its mouth watering touch. Bollywood movies play in the background as I wait, and then dine on my Chicken Mahkani  my 'go-to' meal when I come here. The Garlic Naan is bar none, and I could really just eat that as a mea,l in of itself. The Basmati rice is always cooked to perfection and a nice accompaniment to the entrees. Las Vegas' Best Kept lil secret! Who needs fancy deco when you can have fancy Indian food at an extremely reasonable price. Vegetarian options are always available.  A GREAT first date place..snd a GREAT Happily Ever After regular. LOVE this place!

It was New Year's day and My parents had just come back to town from Argentina. We decided we wanted to go somewhere new for Dinner. I threw out some suggestions and after long debate we all had our hearts set on Thai, we were quickly disappointed when we found out that our favorite thai restaurant was CLOSED for the day, and so were the 3 other Thai restaurants that I called :(! 

So we went to choice number two which was Indian Food. I went onto my HANDY DANDY yelp app and found Mount Everest, I skimmed through some reviews and some people loved it and others didn't. 

My father can be a serious food critic, and he is not afraid to voice his opinion so I was a little nervous and hesitant ... I called ahead and made sure they at least had some good beers, in case the food sucked .


We left my parents house at 4:27pm and We arrived at the Restaurant at approximately 4:45pm, my father was skeptical and kept telling me they were closed, I assured him it wasn't... 
I failed to informed him that I had called ahead of time to make sure they had alcohol . 

the restaurant looked completely dark and there was not much Activity going on anywhere 

Anyways, 
 
after sitting in the car for about 2 minutes my father got restless and wanted to stand outside, so we go outside and stand by the door in like 45 degree weather and within minutes all these people began to get out of their cars and coming from all different places ...

There were about a good ten people waiting behind us . I felt better ...... This seemed promising ! At exactly 4:58 they opened their doors, I know this because I kept looking at my phone because I was freezing! 

Their dinner is from 5-10.

We were all greeted right away and we sat at a booth. They took our drink orders.
The restaurant was clean and pretty. It was very well staffed . 

Within 30 minutes of opening every single table in there was full . 

I ordered a Mango Lasi
My father ordered a Taj Majal of course
and my mother odered a Tea :)
and a round of waters

The mango lasi and the beer came out first and then they informed us that the tea was going to be ready in about 15 minutes. 

Then we went onto order our food, we were famished so everything sounded absolutely wonderful. We ordered a variety of Vegeterian dishes because my mother does not eat meat and some meat dishes for my father an I.

We ordered:

Garlic Naan 
Paneer tikka Masala 
Rice 
Another rice dish that I don't remember the name 

Chicken tikka 
Vegetable pakora 
And other stuff 

And for dessert we had kheer and gulab jamun :)



I was not a fan of the vegetable pakora but my mother loved it . Everything else was delicious and warm ...

And most importantly ... My father was a fan! 

And I'm also a fan!! 

I tried to take pictures of everything and label it correctly . 
BUT I MAY OR MAY NOT HAVE FAILED !



We'll try to the lunch buffet . Hopefully it's just as wonderful . 

Although,

Remember that tea my mother ordered ..... Well she never got the tea . They must have gone to India to pick the leaves or something ....
  
It's ok though, the customer service and the food were Great

The food here is incredible. I've been probably 20 times now and have never been disappointed. The customer service is great, and makes the meals all the better. I'll be back as often as I can. The owner (Prikash, sp?) consistently goes out of his way to make the dining experience even better.

Has to be the best in Las Vegas.
Very casual lunch, and very nice family atmosphere for dinner.
I have been to both. I prefer the lunch buffet. 
Its hard to have Indian cuisine for lunch for me because most places seem more upscale and a dinner style establishment.
Not here! They make it very inviting and laid back! 
The buffet option gives opportunity to learn about most dishes you have never ordered before. It was great! Sample some of everything.

My favorite was the Palak Paneer. Spinach with homemade cheese. If i could eat this with every meal for the rest of my life I think i would!
Chili chicken is very good too!

The spice level was perfect for me, If it gets too hot try a mango lassi drink!
I don't usually drink sweet stuff with my meal, but this drink actually compliments and cools the spice! Very good!

I always suggest this place to friends. I will go anytime!!
Excellent! I have brought the entire office to the buffet, and come back again and brought the wife & family. Don't hesitate to stop in and have your fill of Indian.

I'm surprised I haven't done a review for this place. It's my favorite Indian buffet in Vegas, hands down. It's $10.99 and the food is good. They bring out fresh naan for you and the service is always amazing. The young gentleman that is always there is so sweet and nice. The food is consistent every time I go there and they always keep the stations clean. Never been disappointed with the food nor the service. I even went on a day where the health inspector came unexpectedly! the place was so packed and busy and the young gentleman/server/cashier was able to keep up with everyone's needs, clean up and talk to the health inspector. Keep up the good work!!

Another lunch favorite!  I've been several times for lunch, and always eat at the buffet.  The food is delicious; there's various traditional options, including basmati rice, samosas, chicken dishes (e.g., chicken tikka), dal makhani, and other vegetarian dishes.  There's also fruit.  The buffet actually has a good variety of food.  

My absolute favorite is the sweet rice, which is orange colored and has peanuts (or cashews?) in it.  I have a sweet tooth and love rice, so this is the best of both worlds for me.  I'm not a huge meat eater, but am not vegetarian either so I end up loading up on the sweet rice.    

My runner-up favorite (or actually maybe tied) is the naan.  Whoa nelly, the naan is ALWAYS warm and soft.  We always get a basket that has plain naan and naan with garlic.  The garlic naan is super good.  Although I'm sure it's a huge faux pas, I love getting the orange marmalade from the buffet (for the fruit) and putting just a little on the naan.  That's my dirty little secret at Mt. Everest.

Overall, it's a great place to have lunch.  It's generally busy or at least half way full.  I think it also feels a little nicer because the tables in the center of the restaurant have linen table cloths.  Oh! And another plus -- they usually have a Bollywood movie playing on a flat screen tv above the buffet.  The sound is not on or is low, but it's fun to watch nevertheless!
This place is average. The service is great. My water is always filled but the food is decent. I had better Indian food somewhere else.
Most delicious Chicken Tandoor, Garlic Naan, papadom & pakora. Grassy vegetarian selections, too! Yummy!

What a refreshing dining experience. As we sat down, Prakash (the owner) came by and said hi. Through the evening of great Indian cuisine, Prakash continued to make us feel right at home. Great food, wonderful service and a surprise for dessert.
